title: Rebelde
description:
Rebelde is a Mexican telenovela produced by Televisa and created by Cris Morena. It is a remake of a famous Argentine series Rebelde Way adapted for the Mexican audience therefore leading to differences in characters' backgrounds. The series ran for three seasons, the final episode airing in Mexico on June 2, 2006. Rebelde was replaced in June 2006 with Televisa's new series Código Postal.

The series is set at the Elite Way School, a prestigious private boarding high school in Mexico City with a major plot line revolving around a group of students forming a pop band. Additional subplots involve the school's faculty and the students' parents. One trademark of the show is the random use of English words and phrases, often used by fresa characters.

A notable aspect of the series is that the actors playing the bandmembers are themselves in an actual band named RBD, and perform most of the music used on the show. They have been extremely successful in their own right, becoming one of the most popular acts in Latin America and touring internationally.

Rebelde began airing March 21, 2005 and ended on December 15, 2006. The show was also transmitted in 65 other countries, including Serbia, Peru, Romania on Acasa TV, Brazil, Spain on Antena 3, Slovenia, Bulgaria and from September 2009 in Slovakia on TV Doma, in Croatia on Nova TV and in Albania on Vizion Plus.

seasons.title: Season 1
seasons.description: High school chemistry teacher Walter White's life is suddenly transformed by a dire medical diagnosis. Street-savvy former student Jesse Pinkman "teaches" Walter a new trade.

chapters.title: Pilot
chapters.description: When an unassuming high school chemistry teacher discovers he has a rare form of lung cancer, he decides to team up with a former student and create a top of the line crystal meth in a used RV, to provide for his family once he is gone.

chapters.title: The Cat's in the Bag
chapters.description: Walt and Jesse attempt to tie up loose ends. The desperate situation gets more complicated with the flip of a coin. Walt's wife, Skyler, becomes suspicious of Walt's strange behavior.

chapters.title: ...and the Bag's in the River
chapters.description: Walter fights with Jesse over his drug use, causing him to leave Walter alone with their captive, Krazy-8. Meanwhile, Hank has a scared straight moment with Walter Jr. after his aunt discovers he has been smoking pot. Also, Skylar is upset when Walter stays away from home.

chapters.title: Cancer Man
chapters.description: Walter finally tells his family that he has been stricken with cancer. Meanwhile, the DEA believes Albuquerque has a new, big time player to worry about. Meanwhile, a worthy recipient is the target of a depressed Walter's anger, and Jesse makes a surprise visit to his parents home.

chapters.description: Walter accepts his new identity as a drug dealer after a PTA meeting. Elsewhere, Jesse decides to put his aunt's house on the market and Skyler is the recipient of a baby shower.

seasons.title: Season 2
seasons.description: In the second season, Walt must deal with the chain reaction of his choice, as he and Jesse face new and severe consequences. When danger and suspicion around Walt escalate, he is pushed to new levels of desperation. Just how much higher will the stakes rise? How far is Walt willing to go to ensure his family's security? Will his grand plan spiral out of control?

chapters.title: Mandala
chapters.description: When unforeseen circumstances cause Walt and Jesse to lose some dealers, Saul suggests they add a new business partner. At work, Skylar confronts Ted about the unnerving information she had uncovered. Jane learns what Jesse does for a living when he opens up to her, which ends in disastrous results.

chapters.title: Phoenix
chapters.description: As Walt explores money laundering options, he and Jesse spar over the profits from their latest deal. Jesse and Jane clash with her father. Walt makes a fatal decision.

chapters.title: ABQ
chapters.description: Skylar confronts Walt about his secrecy; Jesse falls apart; and Jane's grief-stricken father takes action that results in further tragedy.

seasons.title: Season 3
seasons.description: In the third season, Walt continues to battle dueling identities: a desperate husband and father trying to provide for his family, and a newly appointed key player in the Albuquerque drug trade. As the danger around him escalates, Walt is now entrenched in the complex worlds of an angst-ridden family on the verge of dissolution, and the ruthless and unrelenting drug cartel.

chapters.title: No Mas
chapters.description: Walt faces a new threat on a new front and deals with an increasingly angry Skyler, who must consider what to do next with her life and the kids'. Meanwhile, Jesse comes face-to-face with some startling self-revelations.

chapters.title: Caballo Sin Nombre
chapters.description: Despite ever-increasing tension between Walt and Skyler, he pulls out all the stops in an effort to reconcile with the family. Elsewhere, Saul is instrumental in getting Jesse involved in a most-unusual investment opportunity.

chapters.title: I.F.T.
chapters.description: Walt ignores Skyler's demands, furthering the rift between them and pushing her to break bad. Still suffering from panic and anxiety attacks, Hank crosses a line at work.

chapters.title: Green Light
chapters.description: Walt loses control as he reacts to Skyler's news, endangering his job and relationships with Saul and Jesse. Hank throws himself into his blue meth investigation. Jesse enacts a new plan.

chapters.title: Mas
chapters.description: Gus increases his efforts to lure Walt back into business, forcing a rift between Walt and Jesse. Skyler doubts her new relationship. Marie confides in Skyler about her concern for Hank's well-being.

chapters.title: Sunset
chapters.description: Walt settles into his new surroundings; Walt, Jr. wants answers about his parents' relationship; Hank's investigation causes problems for Walt and Jesse.

chapters.title: One Minute
chapters.description: Hank's increasing volatility forces a confrontation with Jesse and trouble at work. Skyler pressures Walt to make a deal. Gus' actions have severe consequences.

chapters.title: I See You
chapters.description: The family waits for news about Hank. While Jesse covers at the lab, Walt attempts to placate Gus. After witnessing a disturbing outburst, Walt worries he and his family are in danger.

chapters.title: Kafkaesque
chapters.description: As Hank's hospital bills stack up, Skyler hatches a plan. Walt and Gus come to a better understanding. Jesse, looking for more independence, pursues a new opportunity.

chapters.title: Fly
chapters.description: Walt becomes obsessed with a contaminant in the lab and refuses to finish the cook until it is eliminated. A frustrated Jesse attempts to get Walt back on track.

chapters.title: Abiquiu
chapters.description: Skyler gets involved with Walt's business while Hank struggles with recovery. Jesse has a startling discovery after meeting a girl at group therapy.

chapters.title: Half Measures
chapters.description: Against Walt's advice, Jesse lashes out . Fearing for Jesse's safety, Walt takes drastic action to intervene. A tragic event leads to a shocking confrontation.

chapters.title: Full Measure
chapters.description: With Jesse on the run and Mike in hot pursuit, Walt negotiates a bargain with Gus and concocts a disturbing plan to provide for his and Jesse's safety.

seasons.title: Season 4
seasons.description: This season, Walt and Jesse must cope with the fallout of their previous actions, both personally and professionally. Tension mounts as Walt faces a true standoff with his employer, Gus, with neither side willing or able to back down. Walt must also adjust to a new relationship with Skyler, whom while still reconciling her relationship with Walt, is committed to properly laundering Walt’s money and ensuring her sister Marie and an ailing Hank are financially stable.

chapters.title: Box Cutter
chapters.description: Walt and Jesse face the deadly consequences of their actions. Skyler deals with a puzzling disappearance, as Marie struggles to help Hank with his recovery.

chapters.title: Thirty-Eight Snub
chapters.description: Walt attempts to form a new alliance as he plans his next move. Skyler pushes Walt towards a business opportunity, in hopes of protecting the family.

chapters.title: Open House
chapters.description: Events spiral out of control at Jesse’s place. Skyler reluctantly asks for Saul’s help. Marie returns to an old pastime and a friend asks Hank for help.

chapters.title: Bullet Points
chapters.description: The Cartel takes steps to gain the upper hand. Walt and Skyler share an embarrassing secret with the rest of the family. Jesse’s activities draw unwanted attention.

chapters.title: Shotgun
chapters.description: When Jesse goes missing, Walt fears the worst. Skyler has an unlikely reunion. Hank shares some bad news with Detective Tim Roberts.

chapters.title: Cornered
chapters.description: Skyler makes an unsettling discovery. Walter, Jr. pushes his dad into a questionable purchase. Jesse offers Mike some unexpected help.

chapters.title: Problem Dog
chapters.description: A frustrated Walt gambles on a risky new plan.  Skyler's business venture hits a snag.  Hank recruits Walter, Jr. for an unusual outing.

chapters.title: Hermanos
chapters.description: Skyler develops an unusual solution to her money troubles. Hank enlists Walt to investigate a theory. Walt’s impatience with Jesse grows.

chapters.title: Bug
chapters.description: Skyler's past mistakes come back to haunt her. Gus takes action to thwart his rivals. Jesse seeks Walt's help, with mixed results.

chapters.title: Salud
chapters.description: Walt's family worries when he doesn't turn up for Walter, Jr.'s 16th birthday.  Jesse is forced to put his lab skills to the test without Mr. White's help.

chapters.title: Crawl Space
chapters.description: Walt takes drastic action to protect his secret and Gus. Skyler's efforts to solve Ted's financial problems hit a wall.

chapters.title: End Times
chapters.description: Hank pushes Gomez to pursue one last lead, while Walt struggles to protect the family. Jesse gets alarming news and rushes to meet with Mr. White.

chapters.title: Face Off
chapters.description: Walt and Jesse team up to take on Gus. With Saul's help, Walt finds an unexpected ally.

seasons.title: Season 5
seasons.description:
In season five, Walt is faced with the prospect of moving on in a world without his enemy. As the pressure of a criminal life starts to build, Skyler struggles to keep Walt’s terrible secrets. Facing resistance from sometime adversary and former Fring lieutenant Mike, Walt tries to keep his world from falling apart even as his DEA Agent brother in law, Hank, finds numerous leads that could blaze a path straight to Walt. 

All bad things must come to an end.

chapters.title: Live Free or Die
chapters.description: As Walt deals with the aftermath of the Casa Tranquila explosion, Hank works to wrap up his investigation of Gus' empire.

chapters.title: Madrigal
chapters.description: Walt and Jesse pursue an unlikely business partner. The DEA filters through various leads in hopes of finding something.

chapters.title: Hazard Pay
chapters.description: Walt and Jesse formulate a new business plan. Walt shares a secret with Marie.

chapters.title: Fifty-One
chapters.description: Walt celebrates another birthday. Skyler contemplates her options, and an associate puts a crimp in Walt and Jesse's business strategy.

chapters.title: Dead Freight
chapters.description: Walt's team gets creative to obtain the methylamine they need to continue their operation.

chapters.title: Buyout
chapters.description: Walt, Jesse, and Mike struggle over the future of their business, as occupational hazards weigh on Jesse.

chapters.title: Say My Name
chapters.description: Walt takes control of business matters; Mike deals with the consequences of his actions.

chapters.title: Gliding Over All
chapters.description: Walt takes care of loose ends; Walt makes a dangerous decision.

chapters.title: Blood Money
chapters.description: As Walt and Jesse adjust to life out of the business, Hank grapples with a troubling lead.

chapters.title: Buried
chapters.description: While Skyler's past catches up with her, Walt covers his tracks. Jesse continues to struggle with his guilt.

chapters.title: Confessions
chapters.description: Jesse decides to make a change, while Walt and Skyler try to deal with an unexpected demand.

chapters.title: Rabid Dog
chapters.description: An unusual strategy starts to bear fruit, while plans are set in motion that could change everything.

chapters.title: To'hajiilee
chapters.description: Things heat up for Walt in unexpected ways.

chapters.title: Ozymandias
chapters.description: Everyone copes with radically changed circumstances.

chapters.title: Granite State
chapters.description: Events set in motion long ago move toward a conclusion.

chapters.title: Felina
chapters.description: All bad things must come to an end.

title: Death Note
description: Light Yagami is an ace student with great prospects—and he’s bored out of his mind. But all that changes when he finds the Death Note, a notebook dropped by a rogue Shinigami death god. Any human whose name is written in the notebook dies, and Light has vowed to use the power of the Death Note to rid the world of evil. But will Light succeed in his noble goal, or will the Death Note turn him into the very thing he fights against?

seasons.title: Season 1
seasons.description: It is a long established fact that a reader will be distracted by the readable content of a page when looking at its layout. The point of using Lorem Ipsum is that it has a more-or-less normal distribution

chapters.title: Rebirth
chapters.description: Brilliant but bored high school student Light Yagami suddenly finds himself holding the power of life and death in his hands—the power of the Death Note. He decides to rid the world of evil—by killing off criminals one by one. When the murders start to pile up, genius detective L is on the case, and an epic battle of wits unfolds.

chapters.title: Confrontation
chapters.description: While the world’s criminals continue to drop dead, L meets by computer with representatives from various nations. He requests that a task force be set up in Japan, under the direction of none other than Soichiro Yagami, Light’s father.

chapters.title: Dealings
chapters.description: Ryuk, the Shinigami, or god of death, who dropped the Death Note into the human world, warns Light that someone is on his trail. Light is troubled that he can’t find out the identity of his tracker, and Ryuk suggests an amazing deal...

chapters.title: Pursuit
chapters.description: Light—now known to the world as Kira—tests the Death Note to understand the scope of its powers by killing off six convicts in various ways—and confirms he can control his victims’ actions before they die.

chapters.title: Tactics
chapters.description: Soichiro Yagami demands to meet with L in person when he finds out that L has secretly brought FBI agents into Japan. Light, meanwhile, has found a way to get those very FBI agents off the case—permanently...

chapters.title: Unraveling
chapters.description: Light meets a woman at the Police Department with an urgent message for the Kira task force. As son of the chief investigator, Light listens to her story, and is startled to discover she may have information that could lead to his arrest.

chapters.title: Overcast
chapters.description: Light uses the Death Note to try to get rid of the woman who could get him captured, and is shocked when it doesn’t work. Realizing she must have given him an alias, he’s only got minutes to find out her real name before she tells her story to the task force.

chapters.title: Glare
chapters.description: L insists on setting up bugs and cameras in the homes of Chief Yagami and Deputy Director Kitamura—whom Raye Penber was tracking. But Light is a step ahead as usual—he knows he’s being watched.

chapters.title: Encounter
chapters.description: The murders continue, and L grows suspicious of Light’s too-perfect behavior and decides to investigate him on his own. In order to get closer to Light, L enrolls at the same university and reveals himself to be L.

chapters.title: Doubt
chapters.description: L's suspicion of Light deepens, compelling him to invite Light into the investigation. But then a phone call alerts them that Soichiro Yagami has suffered a heart attack!

chapters.title: Assault
chapters.description: As predicted on the tapes sent to Sakura TV, news anchors and commentators who expressed doubt about Kira die one by one. On further investigation, L concludes that this Kira is not the original—there's a second Kira!

chapters.title: Love
chapters.description: With a second Kira now on the loose, L asks Light to join the task force and pose as the real Kira in order to catch the copycat. Light agrees, hoping to divert suspicion from himself. To his surprise, this new Kira has a special ability even Light lacks…

chapters.title: Confession
chapters.description: Light goes to Aoyama to discover the identity of the second Kira before L becomes more suspicious. But Misa Amane, the new Kira, uses her unusual gift to find Light before he finds her.

chapters.title: Friend
chapters.description: Light and Misa show each other their Death Notes, and Light asks Misa to have her shinigami Rem get rid of L. But Misa asks something of Light in return—to fall in love with her!

chapters.title: Wager
chapters.description: Evidence turns up that points to Misa Amane as the second Kira. In an effort to spare her, Rem forces Misa to forfeit her ownership of the Death Note.

chapters.title: Decision
chapters.description: Misa is in confinement, though her memories of the Death Note have been completely wiped away. When Light is confined as well, the murders stop and suspicion of Light grows stronger. Then suddenly, the killings resume.

chapters.title: Execution
chapters.description: After fifty days of confinement the killings continue, and Misa and Light are released. But L has devised a plan to ensure no more murders occur, and has Light's father, Soichiro, take the two for a ride that may be their last.

chapters.title: Ally
chapters.description: Though L is still suspicious, Light and Misa, their memories of being Kira wiped clean, return to headquarters, where Light notices a strange connection between the recent Kira killings and the Yotsuba Group.

chapters.title: Matsuda
chapters.description: Matsuda, the task force member assigned to watch Misa, is eager to distinguish himself, and while on a job with Misa, he decides to do a little snooping on his own at the Yotsuba Group’s Tokyo headquarters.

chapters.title: Makeshift
chapters.description: L's team discovers that the Yotsuba Group meet in secret to discuss the elimination of individuals who are troublesome to their company, and concludes that Kira must be one of the eight executives. Can Light posing as L ferret out the right one?

chapters.title: Performance
chapters.description: The Task Force uses Misa as a way to get closer to the Yotsuba corporation. But things get complicated when Rem tries to communicate with her.

chapters.title: Guidance
chapters.description: Thanks to Misa, the Task Force now knows the identity of the new Kira and L plans an elaborate scheme to smoke him out of hiding.

chapters.title: Frenzy
chapters.description: L, Light and Misa watch from the investigation team building and wonder who he is talking to. L wonders if Higuchi is talking to a shinigami. Rem convinces Higuchi to go to the station, but she has her own selfish motives for doing so.

chapters.title: Revival
chapters.description: While Higuchi is finally captured, Light inadvertently regains his memories as Kira.

chapters.title: Silence
chapters.description: Light, his memory recovered, orders Misa to begin killing after Higuchi dies. The Shinigami Rem realizes that everything is going according to Light's plan, and that L will arrest Misa as Kira-unless Rem acts quickly.

chapters.title: Renewal
chapters.description: After L's death, the world needs a new great detective. Is Wammy's house, where L comes from, able to find a new super detective who can complete L's hunt for Kira?

chapters.title: Abduction
chapters.description: A new investigator steps forward-Near, a central figure in the SPK, an organization that is trying to catch Kira without relying on L. Near is aware of the existence of the Death Notes and wants to get his hands on one.

chapters.title: Impatience
chapters.description: Light, acting as L, reveals to Near that his sister Sayu has been kidnapped by someone wanting to trade her for the Death Note. Near finds out that the trade will happen in Los Angeles and promises to help, while secretly planning to steal the Death Note and capture Kira.

chapters.title: Father
chapters.description: Mortified over allowing the Death Note to fall into Mello's hands in order to save his daughter, Soichiro puts himself into harm's way in order to get it back.

chapters.title: Justice
chapters.description: Mello busts into SPK headquarters to retrieve a photograph of himself to make sure he won't be killed by Kira. In exchange for Near giving him the picture, Mello drops an important hint about the Death Notes: some of the rules are fake.

chapters.title: Transfer
chapters.description: Near contacts the Japanese task force and determines that Kira is among their members. He asks for insider information, and Aizawa, beginning to doubt Light, responds. Near suspects that the new L is really Light Yagami and that Light is Kira.

chapters.title: Selection
chapters.description: Star newscaster Kiyomi Takada becomes Kira's spokesperson to the world, after Demegawa is deleted by Mikami, and she just so happens to have been Light's girlfriend in college. Aizawa's suspicions about Light grow.

chapters.title: Scorn
chapters.description: Near goes to Japan, allegedly as bait for Kira. Following Light's instructions, Takada asks Mikami to send her five pages of the Death Note. She tells him that he will continue his work in a fake book made to look like the real one.

chapters.title: Vigilance
chapters.description: Aizawa figures out what's going on and tells Near, who already knows about the notes. Near instructs Aizawa to continue watching Light, and then puts in motion a plan to separate Misa from Light.

chapters.title: Malice
chapters.description: Light and Near agree upon a meeting place for the final confrontation. A key player is kidnapped and the end results are shocking.
The Japanese Task Force and the SPK finally meet at YellowBox Warehouse on January 28th. However, a third party has come to the warehouse as well, on Kira's orders to kill everyone else there.

chapters.title: New World
chapters.description: Though Mikami has written all the investigators' names in the Death Note, a minute passes and everyone is still alive. Near seizes Mikami's Death Note, and all is at last revealed.

title: I Am Not Okay with This
description: A teen navigates the complexities of high school, family and her sexuality while dealing with new superpowers. Based on Charles Forsman's graphic novel.

seasons.title: Season 1
seasons.description: It is a long established fact that a reader will be distracted by the readable content of a page when looking at its layout. The point of using Lorem Ipsum is that it has a more-or-less normal distribution

chapters.title: Dear Diary...
chapters.description: When her best friend (and secret crush) hooks up with a crude jock, Syd seethes with anger ... and her feelings boil over in startling ways.

chapters.title: The Master of One F**k
chapters.description: After Dina ditches her for Brad, Syd spends the afternoon with Stan — and learns there's more to him than she thought.

chapters.title: The Party's Over
chapters.description: Memories of her dad send Syd to a dark place. At a party, Dina finds herself torn between Syd and Brad, and Stan asks Syd a question.

chapters.title: Stan by Me
chapters.description: After fighting with her mom, Syd struggles to avoid a meltdown at school. Later, Stan appoints himself Syd's mentor.

chapters.title: Another Day in Paradise
chapters.description: During a stint in detention, Brad offers Syd a truce, and an incident in the library leads to a high-stakes mission.

chapters.title: Like Father, Like Daughter
chapters.description: Syd worries she's being followed. Anxious and determined to get closure about her father's death, she searches the basement for answers.

chapters.title: Deepest, Darkest Secret
chapters.description: Armed with new insight about her dad, Syd vows to stay positive as she goes to the homecoming dance.

title: Locke & Key
description: Three siblings who move into their ancestral estate after their father's gruesome murder discover their new home's magical keys, which must be used in their stand against an evil creature who wants the keys and their powers.

seasons.title: Season 1
seasons.description: It is a long established fact that a reader will be distracted by the readable content of a page when looking at its layout. The point of using Lorem Ipsum is that it has a more-or-less normal distribution

chapters.title: Welcome to Matheson
chapters.description: After the Lockes move into Keyhouse, Bode makes a new acquaintance — and a startling discovery. Tyler and Kinsey try to start over at a new high school.

chapters.title: Trapper / Keeper
chapters.description: While Nina uncovers details about Rendell's past, Kinsey helps out the Savini Squad, Tyler falls in with a bad crowd, and Bode finds another key.

chapters.title: Head Games
chapters.description: Locating a powerful new key sends Bode's spirit soaring. Tyler's simmering rage boils over. Kinsey realizes just how much her fear is holding her back.

chapters.title: The Keepers of the Keys
chapters.description: Sporting a new hairdo and attitude, Kinsey takes a chance with Scot by sharing what's going on inside her head. Tyler tries to impress his crush.

chapters.title: Family Tree
chapters.description: Kinsey uses a key to seek vengeance on a school bully. A troubled Nina finds a sympathetic ear. A long-buried memory casts Rendell in a new light.

chapters.title: The Black Door
chapters.description: Kinsey explores the sea cave with the Savini Squad in tow, Nina confronts Ellie over Joe, and Tyler sabotages his relationship with Jackie.

chapters.title: Dissection
chapters.description: The Locke family faces their worst nightmare when the person responsible for shattering their lives resurfaces and demands one of the keys.

chapters.title: Ray of F**king Sunshine
chapters.description: Tyler and Kinsey feel torn when they figure out why Nina is acting strangely. Bode meets Rufus and Ellie's houseguest. Dodge zeroes in on the Omega Key.

chapters.title: Echoes
chapters.description: As pieces begin to click into place for the Locke siblings, Ellie opens up about her connection to Dodge, and Kinsey comes clean with her friends.

chapters.title: Crown of Shadows
chapters.description: The battle over the Omega Key leads to decisions that can't be undone — and a dangerous door that promises plenty of trouble ahead.

title: Peaky Blinders
description: A gangster family epic set in 1919 Birmingham, England and centered on a gang who sew razor blades in the peaks of their caps, and their fierce boss Tommy Shelby, who means to move up in the world.

seasons.title: Series 1
seasons.description: It is a long established fact that a reader will be distracted by the readable content of a page when looking at its layout. The point of using Lorem Ipsum is that it has a more-or-less normal distribution

chapters.title: Episode 1
chapters.description: Birmingham, 1919. Thomas Shelby controls the Peaky Blinders, one of the city's most feared criminal organisations, but his ambitions go beyond running the streets. When a crate of guns goes missing, Thomas recognises an opportunity to move up in the world.

chapters.title: Episode 2
chapters.description: Thomas fixes a horserace, provoking the ire of local kingpin Billy Kimber. He also starts a war with gypsy family the Lees. Meanwhile, Inspector Campbell carries out a vicious raid of Small Heath in search of the stolen guns.

chapters.title: Episode 3
chapters.description: Thomas Shelby plans to go to Cheltenham races in order to get closer to Billy Kimber. Knowing the gangster's appetite for beautiful women, Thomas invites Grace to accompany him. Meanwhile some IRA sympathisers approach Thomas with an offer to buy the stolen guns.

chapters.title: Episode 4
chapters.description: Thomas Shelby's war with the Lee family of gypsies escalates, and Campbell puts further pressure on him to deliver the stolen guns. Meanwhile Thomas's brother John plans to marry a former prostitute, but Thomas suspects that she's still on the game.

chapters.title: Episode 5
chapters.description: Thomas Shelby has to deal with an IRA chief who has come to Small Heath to avenge his cousin's death. Meanwhile Campbell gets closer to the stolen guns, and Grace has to decide whether her loyalties lie with him or with Thomas.

chapters.title: Episode 6
chapters.description: As Thomas Shelby prepares to oust Billy Kimber, hidden secrets are revealed and the family have to face up to the problems that have divided them. Meanwhile, Campbell, obsessed with taking down the Peaky Blinders, unleashes one last plan to destroy them.

seasons.title: Series 2
seasons.description: As the 1920s begin to roar, business is booming for the Peaky Blinders gang. Shelby sets his sights on wider horizons and his meteoric rise brings him into contact with both the upper echelons of society and astonishing new adversaries from London’s criminal world. All will test him to the core, though in very different ways. Meanwhile, Shelby’s home turf faces new challenges as an enemy from his past returns to the city with plans for a revenge of biblical proportions.

chapters.title: Episode 1
chapters.description: Business is booming for the Peaky Blinders, as Shelby starts expanding both his legal and illegal operations. He plans for the future, looking at managing a race track in the South. He soon comes across some new adversaries, testing him in very different ways. Back in Birmingham, Shelby's home town is challenged by members of his family reacting to the upturn in their fortunes. A enemy from his past also returns hoping to exact their plan of revenge of biblical proportions.

chapters.title: Episode 2
chapters.description: Tommy offers to help Polly by searching for her children, who long ago were taken from her. In London, Tommy risks his life by meeting enigmatic leader Alfie Solomons. Meanwhile Arthur continues to feel the devastating effects of the Great War.

chapters.title: Episode 3
chapters.description: Tommy hatches a plan to take control of the southern racecourses. He also meets the aristocratic May Carleton, and sees an opportunity to move up in the world. Meanwhile both Major Campbell and London gangster Darby Sabini plan Tommy's downfall.

chapters.title: Episode 4
chapters.description: Arthur leads the Peaky Blinders takeover of London's Eden Club. Sabini decides to put old feuds to one side, convincing Alfie to one side to get rid of the Peaky Blinders. Tommy hires May Carleton to train his race horse, and the pair become fast friends. In Birmingham, Michael joins the family firm, hoping to help Tommy's businesses become more legitimate. Whilst Tommy's insecurities are intensified as he discovers what Major Campbell wants him to do.

chapters.title: Episode 5
chapters.description: Arthur and Michael both end up arrested and imprisoned. As Tommy's base in London is obliterated. Major Campbell has Tommy and his family under his thumb. Polly compromises herself hoping to secure Michael's freedom, but their relationship may be beyond repair at this point. Someone from Tommy's past pays him a visit, opening old wounds and leaving him to make a impossible decision.

chapters.title: Episode 6
chapters.description: As derby day arrives, Tommy is faced with impossible decisions as he plans to strike back at his enemies and take the family business to another level. Meanwhile, Major Campbell has one final card to play - one that he is certain will bring about Tommy's demise.

seasons.title: Series 3
seasons.description: The action has moved on two years to 1924 and as Tommy starts married life he is more determined than ever to go legitimate and keep his family safe. But he finds himself pulled into a web of intrigue more lethal than anything he has yet encountered.

chapters.title: Episode 1
chapters.description: Thomas Shelby’s wedding day has arrived at last, but while his guests enjoy the celebrations he has important business to conduct, as a mysterious stranger makes their presence known.

chapters.title: Episode 2
chapters.description: Tommy goes to London to meet the wildly eccentric and volatile Duke Leon and soon discovers the extreme lengths his new paymasters are willing to go to in their quest for power. In Birmingham a personal dispute with the Italians threatens to explode into a devastating war.

chapters.title: Episode 3
chapters.description: Responding to the Italians’ actions, Tommy is set on a path of deadly vengeance that could take him to his darkest place yet, and threatens to splinter the family. As Arthur struggles with his conscience, Linda implores him to stop his illicit work with the Peaky Blinders.

chapters.title: Episode 4
chapters.description: Tommy takes his brothers on a hunting expedition and shares some  important family news. He also outlines his intentions for the most  daring criminal act the Peaky Blinders have ever undertaken.

chapters.title: Episode 5
chapters.description: As the Russians test the Peaky Blinders men in their own distinctive and  debauched way, Tommy realises that he is being seriously outmanoeuvred.  Desperate for help, he rekindles a business relationship with a  dangerous former acquaintance.

chapters.title: Episode 6
chapters.description: As Tommy prepares to commit the most audacious crime  of his career, an unexpected blow is struck, putting him under  unbearable pressure. As he faces his worst fears he needs help more than ever, but is increasingly uncertain about whom he can trust. In a nerve-shredding race against time, Tommy is forced to confront  hard truths about himself and his family that could change the Peaky  Blinders forever.

seasons.title: Series 4
seasons.description: It is 1924, Tommy Shelby is caught in a dangerous web of international intrigue.

chapters.title: The Noose
chapters.description: December 1925. When Tommy receives a mysterious letter on Christmas Eve, he realises that the Shelbys are in danger of annihilation.

chapters.title: Heathens
chapters.description: As the Shelbys come to terms with the shocking events of Christmas Day, Tommy endeavours to unite his family and a bold new enemy makes his move.

chapters.title: Blackbird
chapters.description: Tradition weighs upon Arthur as Changretta finds a chink in the Shelby armour and Changretta continues to plan ways to continue the vendetta in the most devastating way possible.

chapters.title: Dangerous
chapters.description: The Peaky Blinders are lured by the Italians into a cat-and-mouse chase on the streets of Birmingham.  As his factory lies idle, Tommy confronts the possibility that the Communists might win and he will be deemed a traitor to his class.

chapters.title: The Duel
chapters.description: Tommy finds himself engaged in bloody battle with Luca Changretta and his gang. Lizzie has even greater news to break. Meanwhile, an army colonel has questions for Ada about her past as a communist, and Jessie Eden confirms just how far she is prepared to go in pursuit of her cause.

chapters.title: The Company
chapters.description: It is the night of the big fight - Bonnie Gold versus Goliath. But as the bell rings and the crowd goes wild, dangers lurk in the shadows for Tommy Shelby and his family. When Changretta plays his final ace, he sets in motion a series of events that will change the Peaky Blinders forever.

seasons.title: Series 5
seasons.description: It is 1929, Tommy Shelby MP is approached by a charismatic politician with a bold vision for Britain, he realises that his response will affect not just his family’s future but that of the entire nation.

chapters.title: Black Tuesday
chapters.description: 1929 – While his family deals with the repercussions of the Wall Street Crash, Tommy Shelby MP faces new dangers from unexpected quarters.

chapters.title: Black Cats
chapters.description: The Peaky Blinders come under fire when Tommy finds danger on his doorstep and a friend is brutally attacked. Could there be a traitor in the Shelby family’s midst?

chapters.title: Strategy
chapters.description: As the charismatic Mosley shows his hand, Tommy prepares to make a treacherous new alliance.

chapters.title: The Loop
chapters.description: Tommy agrees to dangerous new partnerships when a golden opportunity presents itself, and a Shelby party promises fireworks.

chapters.title: The Shock
chapters.description: As Tommy reveals his intentions for Mosley, someone close to the Shelbys is targeted.

chapters.title: Mr Jones
chapters.description: News of Tommy's activities have reached Winston Churchill. At a family meeting, Tommy lays out his plans for Mosley, which will take place at a rally Sir Oswald is leading. Tommy is surprised by another strategy, coming from an unexpected corner. Meanwhile, Tommy has his own secrets to reveal.

title: Narcos: Mexico
description: See the rise of the Guadalajara Cartel as an American DEA agent learns the danger of targeting narcos in 1980s Mexico.

seasons.title: Season 1
seasons.description: Narcos tells the true-life story of the growth and spread of cocaine drug cartels across the globe and attendant efforts of law enforcement to meet them head on in brutal, bloody conflict. It centers around the notorious Colombian cocaine kingpin Pablo Escobar (Wagner Moura) and Steve Murphy (Holbrook), a DEA agent sent to Colombia on a U.S. mission to capture him and ultimately kill him.

chapters.title: Camelot
chapters.description: When the army pillages ​Sinaloa, ​an ambitious pot farmer pitches a plan to build a drug empire in Guadalajara. A young DEA agent transfers to Mexico.

chapters.title: The Plaza System
chapters.description: Félix tries to unite all of the plazas while Rafa searches for water for his seedless weed. Police corruption and the DEA’s complacency frustrate Kiki.

chapters.title: El Padrino
chapters.description: Kiki flies solo on a risky undercover operation. Félix turns to his mentor for advice as conflict between the cops and the traffickers escalates.

chapters.title: Rafa, Rafa, Rafa!
chapters.description: After months of frustration, Kiki seizes an opportunity. Rafa runs afoul of powerful government officials, putting Félix in a difficult position.

chapters.title: The Colombian Connection
chapters.description: A threat leaves Mika shaken. Félix envisions a different kind of future for the Guadalajara cartel.

chapters.title: La Última Frontera
chapters.description: A violent power struggle erupts between Falcón and Rafa. As Félix finds a footing in the cocaine business, the DEA tries to lure him into the U.S.

chapters.title: Jefe de Jefes
chapters.description: María implores Félix to move back to Sinaloa. Kiki gathers evidence of the Guadalajara cartel’s pot fields. Neto mourns.

chapters.title: Just Say No
chapters.description: After the DEA closes in on Rafa's enormous pot field, Félix tries to stop his associates from retaliating. Kiki and Jaime meet with investigators.

chapters.title: 881 Lope de Vega
chapters.description: A desperate Jaime is stymied by bureaucratic paperwork. Mika worries about her husband. Félix urges Rafa to disappear.

chapters.title: Leyenda
chapters.description: As pressure mounts, Félix returns to Sinaloa. An enraged Jaime and Mika seek justice and answers.

seasons.title: Season 2
seasons.description: It is a long established fact that a reader will be distracted by the readable content of a page when looking at its layout. The point of using Lorem Ipsum is that it has a more-or-less normal distribution

chapters.title: Salva El Tigre
chapters.description: While celebrating his 40th birthday, Félix worries about his associates' loyalty and confronts Pacho. Walt and his team plan retaliatory kidnappings.

chapters.title: Alea lacta Est
chapters.description: Verdin taunts the DEA agents torturing him. Félix offers opium dealer Guerra a partnership deal. Benjamín's sister Enedina poses a new business idea.

chapters.title: Ruben Zuno Arce
chapters.description: Multiple advisers counsel Félix to go into hiding as the Americans close in on the men involved in Kiki's murder. Amado helps Acosta resolve a feud.

chapters.title: The Big Dig
chapters.description: Zuno testifies in front of a grand jury. Isabella tries to broker a deal with Enedina. Félix makes a daring offer to a U.S. contact.

chapters.title: AFO
chapters.description: Calderoni briefs Walt on the tension between the plazas as Chapo continues construction of his tunnel. Félix's meeting with Pacho takes a turn.

chapters.title: El Dedazo
chapters.description: Félix meets with a political leader. Benjamín takes a stand when the Sinaloa and Tijuana rivalry intensifies. Walt's team turns its attention to planes.

chapters.title: Truth and Reconciliation
chapters.description: Félix proposes a new plan to help the PRI win the election and defeat Cárdenas. Promised intel on Félix, Walt takes an unexpected meeting in Ojinaga.

chapters.title: Se Cayó El Sistema
chapters.description: Mexican authorities, the FBI and Félix all seek out Acosta after a newspaper publishes an interview with him. The presidential election begins.

chapters.title: Growth, Prosperity, and Liberation
chapters.description: Félix stakes the future of his entire cartel on the delivery of 70 tons of cocaine as Walt and the DEA plan to topple the kingpin's empire.

chapters.title: Free Trade
chapters.description: After meeting with Pacho, Félix presents the plaza bosses with a new business plan. Walt receives a surprising invitation.

title: Sherlock
description: A modern update finds the famous sleuth and his doctor partner solving crime in 21st century London.

seasons.title: Specials
seasons.description: It is a long established fact that a reader will be distracted by the readable content of a page when looking at its layout. The point of using Lorem Ipsum is that it has a more-or-less normal distribution

chapters.title: Unaired Pilot
chapters.description:
Sherlock was announced as a single 60-minute drama production at the Edinburgh International Television Festival in August 2008, to be broadcast in Autumn 2009, with the intention of producing a full series should the pilot be successful. The BBC decided not to transmit the pilot, as is common industry practice, but commissioned three 90-minute episodes. 

This is the 60 minute pilot.

chapters.title: Unlocking Sherlock
chapters.description: A 32-minute documentary about the production of the series

chapters.title: Sherlock Uncovered
chapters.description: The stars of Sherlock, Benedict Cumberbatch and Martin Freeman, talk in depth about the success of the first season and look ahead to season 2. This bonus feature also includes the show's creators, Steven Moffat and Mark Gatiss, discussing the dilemmas and pitfalls they faced when bringing these classic Holmes stories into the 21st century.

chapters.title: Many Happy Returns
chapters.description: Anderson believes that Sherlock is still alive after the Reichenbach fall. He confides in Lestrade and tells him his theory for his existence. Anderson believes a string of events ranging from Tibet to India to Germany involve Sherlock's assistance, and this is due to Sherlock not being able to stop investigating. Lestrade tells him Sherlock is definitely dead and goes to visit John, who has moved out of Baker Street following his death. He gives him some of Sherlock's old items, including a video message from John's birthday. In the message Sherlock states that he will see John very soon and tells him to have a good birthday without him as he is 'busy'.

chapters.title: Unlocking Sherlock
chapters.description: Find out how writers Steven Moffat and Mark Gatiss created the television hit Sherlock, taking Sir Arthur Conan Doyle's original adventures of the Victorian super sleuth and transforming them into a worldwide sensation. And we go behind the scenes on set with the stars of Sherlock. Featuring interviews with lead actors Benedict Cumberbatch and Martin Freeman, and Sir Arthur Conan Doyle.

chapters.title: Sherlock Uncovered: The Return
chapters.description: Sherlock's back! The world's greatest detective comes back from the dead. But how did he do it? We go behind-the-scenes of the first episode cast read-through, with Benedict Cumberbatch and Martin Freeman where the answer to television's greatest mystery was first revealed. And we uncover the unlikely friendship between Sherlock Holmes and Dr John Watson.

chapters.title: Sherlock Uncovered: The Women
chapters.description: The stars of Sherlock talk about the women in the life of TV's greatest detective. Sherlock Holmes may be great at solving mysteries, but he's clueless about women. We launch an investigation into the women in Sherlock's life. Mary Morstan is marrying his best friend. Irene Adler stole his heart. He doesn't know Molly exists. And Mrs Hudson's always there to pick up the pieces.

chapters.title: Sherlock Uncovered: The Villains
chapters.description: We meet the great villains who've battled with TV's greatest detective. There's Jim Moriarty, his nemesis. There's Charles Augustus Magnussen, the only man Sherlock Holmes truly hates. And then there's Mycroft Holmes - Sherlock's brother and the last word in sibling rivalry. All of them have had influence over those closest to Sherlock. And all of them cause him grief.

chapters.title: The Abominable Bride
chapters.description: Sherlock Holmes and Doctor Watson investigate a mysterious ghostly bride who appears to have committed murder from beyond the grave.

seasons.title: Series 1
seasons.description: When a chance encounter brings soldier John Watson into Sherlock's life, it's apparent the two men couldn't be more different, but Sherlock's intellect coupled with John's pragmatism soon forges an unbreakable alliance as they investigate a series of baffling cases together.

chapters.title: A Study in Pink
chapters.description: A war hero, invalided home from Afghanistan, meets a strange but charismatic genius who is looking for a flatmate; it is London, 2010, and Dr Watson and Sherlock Holmes are meeting for the first time. A string of impossible suicides has Scotland Yard baffled - and only one man can help.

chapters.title: The Blind Banker
chapters.description: A mysterious cipher is being scrawled on the walls around London. The first person to see the cipher is dead within hours of reading it. Sherlock plunges into a world of codes and symbols, consulting with London's best graffiti artists. He soon learns that the city is in the grip a gang of international smugglers, a secret society called the Black Lotus.

chapters.title: The Great Game
chapters.description: A strange clue in an empty room, a blood-soaked car, a priceless Old Master, a deranged bomber. With the clock ticking, the curtain rises on a battle of wits between Sherlock, John and the shadowy stranger who seems to know all the answers...

seasons.title: Series 2
seasons.description: A Royal scandal, a dazzling game of cat and mouse. The seductive Irene Adler is cold, calculating, brilliant. Has Sherlock finally met his match?

chapters.title: A Scandal in Belgravia
chapters.description:
Compromising photographs and a case of blackmail threaten the very heart of the British establishment, but for Sherlock and John the game is on in more ways than one as they find themselves battling international terrorism, rogue CIA agents, and a secret conspiracy involving the British government. 

This case will cast a darker shadow over their lives than they could ever imagine, as the great detective begins a long duel of wits with an antagonist as cold and ruthless and brilliant as himself: to Sherlock Holmes, Irene Adler will always be THE woman.

chapters.title: The Hounds of Baskerville
chapters.description:
Something terrible has happened to Henry Knight; Sherlock and John investigate the truth about the monstrous creature which apparently killed their client's father. 

A hound from hell? What seems like fantasy in Baker Street is a very different prospect in the ultra-secret army base that looms over Dartmoor.

chapters.title: The Reichenbach Fall
chapters.description:
James Moriarty possesses the greatest criminal mind that the world has ever seen. Sherlock and John knew he wouldn't stay hidden for long, but even they never guessed the sheer scale and audacity of the crime that would propel Moriarty back into the headlines.

The crime of the century; The Tower of London, the Bank of England and Pentonville prison - all sprung open on the same day, as if by magic! But Moriarty's plans don't stop there... Sherlock and John lock horns with their old enemy in one final problem that tests loyalty and courage to their very limits. 

Sherlock must fight for his reputation, his sanity and his life. But is he all he claims to be?

seasons.title: Series 3
seasons.description: Sherlock is back, but will things ever be the same again?

chapters.title: The Empty Hearse
chapters.description: Two years on from reports of his Reichenbach Fall demise, Sherlock resurfaces as London comes under threat of a huge terrorist attack. John, though, has mixed feelings - he's delighted by the return of his best friend, but harbours worries that the consulting detective's reappearance will have an adverse affect on his settled domestic life, in particular his romance with Mary Morstan.

chapters.title: The Sign of Three
chapters.description: Sherlock faces his biggest challenge of all – delivering a Best Man’s speech on John’s wedding day! But all isn’t quite as it seems. Mortal danger stalks the reception – and someone might not make it to the happy couple’s first dance. Sherlock must thank the bridesmaids, solve the case and stop a killer.

chapters.title: His Last Vow
chapters.description: A case of stolen letters leads Sherlock Holmes into a long conflict with Charles Augustus Magnussen, the Napoleon of blackmail, and the one man he truly hates. But how do you tackle a foe who knows the personal weakness of every person of importance in the Western world?

seasons.title: Series 4
seasons.description: The fourth series begins with the nation’s favourite detective, the mercurial Sherlock Holmes, back once more on British soil, as Doctor Watson and his wife, Mary, prepare for their biggest ever challenge - becoming parents for the first time.

chapters.title: The Six Thatchers
chapters.description: Sherlock waits to see where Moriarty will make his posthumous move. One mysterious case in particular baffles Scotland Yard - but Sherlock is more interested in a seemingly-trivial detail. Why is someone destroying images of the late Prime Minister Margaret Thatcher? Is there a madman on the loose? Or is there a much darker purpose at work? Something with its roots deep in Mary Watson's past…

chapters.title: The Lying Detective
chapters.description: Sherlock faces perhaps the most chilling enemy of his long career: the powerful and seemingly unassailable Culverton Smith - a man with a very dark secret indeed.

chapters.title: The Final Problem
chapters.description: Holmes and Watson travel to Europe to escape Moriarty's vengeance.

title: Gravity Falls
description: Twin brother and sister Dipper and Mabel Pines are in for an unexpected adventure when they spend the summer helping their great uncle Stan run a tourist trap in the mysterious town of Gravity Falls, Oregon.

seasons.title: Specials
seasons.description: It is a long established fact that a reader will be distracted by the readable content of a page when looking at its layout. The point of using Lorem Ipsum is that it has a more-or-less normal distribution

chapters.description: Dipper and Mabel must battle a monster who takes their Summerween candy.

chapters.title: Dipper's Guide to the Unexplained - Stan's Tattoo
chapters.description: Dipper devises a plan to unravel the enigma that is Stan’s tattoo.

chapters.title: Dipper's Guide to the Unexplained - Mailbox
chapters.description: Dipper and Soos stumble upon a mailbox in the middle of the forest and make it their mission to discover who (or what) picks up the mail left inside.

chapters.title: Dipper's Guide to the Unexplained - Lefty
chapters.description: Dipper sets out to discover why a certain Gravity Falls resident always faces left.

chapters.title: Dipper's Guide to the Unexplained - Tooth
chapters.description: Dipper and Mabel find a gigantic tooth on the shores of the lake, and set out in a rowboat to find out where it came from.

chapters.title: Dipper's Guide to the Unexplained - The Hide Behind
chapters.description: After hearing rumors of a local lumberjack legend, Dipper investigates a mysterious creature that has been heard, but never seen.

chapters.title: Mabel's Guide to Life - Dating
chapters.description: Mabel gives her thoughts on dating and puts her dating quiz to the test with three of Gravity Falls’ most eligible bachelors — Grunkle Stan, Dipper and Soos.

chapters.title: Mabel's Guide to Life - Stickers
chapters.description: Mabel gives her unique perspective on the history of stickers, their many styles and uses.

chapters.title: Mabel's Guide to Life - Fashion
chapters.description: Mabel reveals her fashion secrets to the world, including FLASH MAKEOVERS!

chapters.title: Mabel's Guide to Life - Colors
chapters.description: Mabel’s survey into everyone’s favorite colors causes a color emergency when she learns Grunkle Stan has never seen a rainbow.

chapters.title: Mabel's Guide to Life - Art
chapters.description: Mabel reveals that her gift of art has driven her to genius level with the creation of her own personal art movement — the “Caticature.”

chapters.title: Fixin' It with Soos - Golf Cart
chapters.description: Soos fixes up the golf cart so that Dipper and Wendy can perform a stunt.

chapters.title: Fixin' It with Soos - Cuckoo Clock
chapters.description: Soos fixes up a Cuckoo Clock and gives it an ultra-awesome remodel.

chapters.title: TV Shorts #1
chapters.description: Mabel watches the public television of Gravity Falls. On the television she finds a Mystery Shack TV commercial, some words by Soos, and footage of Gideon in the prison, which appears to be a sort of reality show about his interaction with fellow inmates.

chapters.title: TV Shorts #2
chapters.description: Grunkle Stan watches Ducktective, Teenz Talk, and Why you ackin so cray cray.

chapters.title: Mabel's Scrapbook - Heist Movie
chapters.description: Mabel recalls the Pines' eleborate plan to break into a movie theatre.

chapters.title: Mabel's Scrapbook - Petting Zoo
chapters.description: Mabel remembers when the family visited a petting zoo.

seasons.title: Season 1
seasons.description: The first season of the American animated television series Gravity Falls consisted of 20 episodes on the Disney Channel, and aired from June 15, 2012 to August 2, 2013.

chapters.title: Tourist Trapped
chapters.description: Twins Dipper and Mabel Pines visit their eccentric great-uncle for a summer in Gravity Falls, Oregon, where he operates the world's most bizarre museum. As soon as the twins arrive in Gravity Falls, they discover something amiss in the remote town.

chapters.title: The Legend of the Gobblewonker
chapters.description: When Dipper and Mabel hear rumors of a sea monster that lives at the bottom of the local lake, they enlist Soos to take them on a boating expedition to prove it really does exist.

chapters.title: Headhunters
chapters.description: When someone tampers with Mabel's life-size wax statue of Grunkle Stan, she and Dipper set out to find the culprit. Meanwhile, Grunkle Stan mourns over the loss of his wax doppelganger.

chapters.title: The Hand That Rocks the Mabel
chapters.description: Dipper and Mabel discover that their seemingly cherubic new neighbor, Lil' Gideon, happens to be the town's adored psychic. But when Lil' Gideon guilts her into dating him, she and Dipper soon learn that his cuteness can fade all too quickly.

chapters.title: The Inconveniencing
chapters.description: Dipper is invited by Wendy and her teen friends on a trek that leads to an abandoned convenience store that may be haunted.

chapters.title: Dipper vs. Manliness
chapters.description: In a quest to attain manliness, Dipper ventures into the forest to battle the notorious Multi-Bear. Meanwhile, Mabel tries to teach Grunkle Stan how to be attractive to women, particularly the waitress in the local diner, Lazy Susan.

chapters.title: Double Dipper
chapters.description: Stan throws a big weekend party to promote the Mystery Shack. Dipper makes clones of himself to impress Wendy. Mabel fights for the Party Queen title in honor of her two friends.

chapters.title: Irrational Treasure
chapters.description: When Dipper and Mabel discover evidence that the reported town founder is a hoax, they set out to expose the historical cover-up and prove that Mabel's silliness is not a bad thing.

chapters.title: The Time Traveler's Pig
chapters.description: Dipper wants to correct a mistake he made in the past with assistance from a time machine. Mabel is overjoyed when she wins a pet pig at a fair.

chapters.title: Fight Fighters
chapters.description: After being challenged to a video game battle by Robbie, Dipper is shocked when his favorite playable fighter, Rumble McSkirmish, comes to life to defend him. But Dipper soon loses control over Rumble McSkirmish and has to find a way to stop him.

chapters.title: Little Dipper
chapters.description: Dipper is self-conscious that Mabel is taller than him and seeks a magic solution. Meanwhile Lil' Gideon takes advantage of Dipper's and Mabel's height discrepancy.

chapters.title: Summerween
chapters.description: Dipper and Mabel go trick-or-treating in the summer and encounter a candy-loving monster who threatens to devour them if they don't bring him sweet things to eat.

chapters.title: Boss Mabel
chapters.description: Stan leaves Mabel in charge of the Mystery Shack while he is gone and the power goes to her head.

chapters.title: Bottomless Pit!
chapters.description: While Stan, Dipper, Mabel and Soos are falling in a bottomless pit, they tell stories to pass the time.

chapters.title: The Deep End
chapters.description: When Mabel befriends a cute merman trapped in the public pool, she's determined to help him out. Meanwhile, Dipper decides to volunteer as a lifeguard to see Wendy.

chapters.title: Carpet Diem
chapters.description: The twins discover a hidden room inside the Mystery Shack and compete over who should have it.

chapters.title: Boyz Crazy
chapters.description: When Mabel discovers that her favorite boy band is actually a bunch of imprisoned clones, she sets them free, only to decide on keeping them for herself. Meanwhile, Dipper is convinced that Robbie plans to brainwash Wendy with a secret message hidden inside one of his songs.

chapters.title: Land Before Swine
chapters.description: When Waddles is snatched by a prehistoric beast, Dipper, Mabel, Stan, Soos, and Old Man McGucket must journey to a mysterious land trapped in time to rescue him.

chapters.title: Dreamscaperers
chapters.description: Dipper, Mabel, and Soos must travel through Grunkle Stan's mind to defeat a tricky dream demon summoned by Lil Gideon.

chapters.title: Gideon Rises
chapters.description: Li'l Gideon swindles the Mystery Shack away, forcing Grunkle Stan and the kids to move in with Soos. While Stan weighs how he can still care for his grandniece and nephew, they decide to take on Gideon.

seasons.title: Season 2
seasons.description: It is a long established fact that a reader will be distracted by the readable content of a page when looking at its layout. The point of using Lorem Ipsum is that it has a more-or-less normal distribution

chapters.title: Scary-oke
chapters.description: The Pines family is starting to get everything back to normal after the Lil' Gideon incident. They throw a “Mystery Shack Is Back” party, but some unwelcome guests intend to crash it.

chapters.title: Into the Bunker
chapters.description: Dipper’s secret journal pages lead him and the gang to the author’s hidden bunker where they find themselves face-to-face with a mysterious figure from Gravity Falls’ lore.

chapters.title: The Golf War
chapters.description: After being belittled by Pacifica one too many times, Mabel challenges her to a miniature golf-off which gets a tad out of control when some local residents offer their help.

chapters.title: Sock Opera
chapters.description: Mabel decides to put on a sock puppet rock opera to impress a local puppeteer, but her show goes awry when Dipper's drive to uncover more of the journal's secrets leads to a supernatural disaster.

chapters.title: Soos and the Real Girl
chapters.description: Soos needs a date for his cousin Reggie's engagement party and looks to a dating simulator game to help him talk to girls.

chapters.title: Little Gift Shop of Horrors
chapters.description: In three separate mysterious tales, Stan is cursed by a Witch, Waddles accidentally eats a bowl of brain-enhancing jelly and builds a machine that allows him to speak, and Mabel faces her fear of claymation.

chapters.title: Society of the Blind Eye
chapters.description: The kids, along with Old Man McGucket's help, discover there is a secret society in Gravity Falls.

chapters.title: Blendin's Game
chapters.description: Blendin returns to face off with Dipper and Mabel in a futuristic battle that could trap them forever in time jail.

chapters.title: The Love God
chapters.description: Mabel takes matchmaking too far when she steals a love potion from a real Love God.

chapters.title: Northwest Mansion Noir
chapters.description: Pacifica enlists Dipper’s help to rid the Northwest Mansion of a ghost before he wreaks havoc on her fancy party.

chapters.title: Not What He Seems
chapters.description: After agents Powers and Trigger take Stan into custody, Dipper and Mabel begin to wonder how much they actually know about their Grunkle Stan.

chapters.title: A Tale of Two Stans
chapters.description: Cornered underneath the Mystery Shack, Stan must finally reveal the secrets of his past and his mysterious portal to Dipper and Mabel.

chapters.title: Dungeons, Dungeons, & More Dungeons
chapters.description: Dipper finds an unlikely friend to join him with his newest obsession, a board game called “Dungeons, Dungeons & More Dungeons.”

chapters.title: The Stanchurian Candidate
chapters.description: When Grunkle Stan decides to run for mayor, Dipper and Mabel have their work cut out for them trying to turn their gaffe-prone uncle into the perfect candidate.

chapters.title: The Last Mabelcorn
chapters.description: A new threat leads Mabel to venture into the enchanted realm of the unicorns. Meanwhile, Dipper learns an unexpected twist about the enigmatic Bill Cipher.

chapters.title: Roadside Attraction
chapters.description: Grunkle Stan takes the kids with him on a road-trip to sabotage all the other tourist traps in Oregon.

chapters.title: Dipper and Mabel vs. the Future
chapters.description: Mabel makes plans for her and Dipper's 13th birthday party; Dipper ventures below the town and discovers its most shocking secret.

chapters.title: Weirdmageddon Part I
chapters.description: Bill has returned to take down the Pines family. But this time he has brought some of his friends with him.

chapters.title: Weirdmageddon 2: Escape from Reality
chapters.description: Dipper, Soos and Wendy must save Mabel from a strange new world, while Bill's forces plan their next move.

chapters.title: Weirdmageddon 3: Take Back the Falls
chapters.description: Ford discovers Bill’s true motives and a final confrontation with Bill leads to the Pines family’s ultimate fate and greatest sacrifice.

title: Stranger Things
description: When a young boy vanishes, a small town uncovers a mystery involving secret experiments, terrifying supernatural forces, and one strange little girl.

seasons.title: Stranger Things
seasons.description: Strange things are afoot in Hawkins, Indiana, where a young boy's sudden disappearance unearths a young girl with otherworldly powers.

chapters.title: Chapter One: The Vanishing of Will Byers
chapters.description: On his way home from a friend's house, young Will sees something terrifying. Nearby, a sinister secret lurks in the depths of a government lab.

chapters.title: Chapter Two: The Weirdo on Maple Street
chapters.description: Lucas, Mike and Dustin try to talk to the girl they found in the woods. Hopper questions an anxious Joyce about an unsettling phone call.

chapters.title: Chapter Three: Holly, Jolly
chapters.description: An increasingly concerned Nancy looks for Barb and finds out what Jonathan's been up to. Joyce is convinced Will is trying to talk to her.

chapters.title: Chapter Four: The Body
chapters.description: Refusing to believe Will is dead, Joyce tries to connect with her son. The boys give Eleven a makeover. Nancy and Jonathan form an unlikely alliance.

chapters.title: Chapter Five: The Flea and the Acrobat
chapters.description: Hopper breaks into the lab while Nancy and Jonathan confront the force that took Will. The boys ask Mr. Clarke how to travel to another dimension.

chapters.title: Chapter Six: The Monster
chapters.description: A frantic Jonathan looks for Nancy in the darkness, but Steve's looking for her, too. Hopper and Joyce uncover the truth about the lab's experiments.

chapters.title: Chapter Seven: The Bathtub
chapters.description: Eleven struggles to reach Will, while Lucas warns that "the bad men are coming." Nancy and Jonathan show the police what Jonathan caught on camera.

chapters.title: Chapter Eight: The Upside Down
chapters.description: Dr. Brenner holds Hopper and Joyce for questioning while the boys wait with Eleven in the gym. Back at Will's, Nancy and Jonathan prepare for battle.

seasons.title: Stranger Things 2
seasons.description: It's been nearly a year since Will's strange disappearance. But life's hardly back to normal in Hawkins. Not even close.

chapters.title: Chapter One: MADMAX
chapters.description: As the town preps for Halloween, a high-scoring rival shakes things up at the arcade, and a skeptical Hopper inspects a field of rotting pumpkins.

chapters.title: Chapter Two: Trick or Treat, Freak
chapters.description: After Will sees something terrible on trick-or-treat night, Mike wonders whether Eleven's still out there. Nancy wrestles with the truth about Barb.

chapters.title: Chapter Three: The Pollywog
chapters.description: Dustin adopts a strange new pet, and Eleven grows increasingly impatient. A well-meaning Bob urges Will to stand up to his fears.

chapters.title: Chapter Four: Will the Wise
chapters.description: An ailing Will opens up to Joyce -- with disturbing results. While Hopper digs for the truth, Eleven unearths a surprising discovery.

chapters.title: Chapter Five: Dig Dug
chapters.description: Nancy and Jonathan swap conspiracy theories with a new ally as Eleven searches for someone from her past. “Bob the Brain” tackles a difficult problem.

chapters.title: Chapter Six: The Spy
chapters.description: Will's connection to a shadowy evil grows stronger, but no one's quite sure how to stop it. Elsewhere, Dustin and Steve forge an unlikely bond.

chapters.title: Chapter Seven: The Lost Sister
chapters.description: Psychic visions draw Eleven to a band of violent outcasts and an angry girl with a shadowy past.

chapters.title: Chapter Eight: The Mind Flayer
chapters.description: An unlikely hero steps forward when a deadly development puts the Hawkins Lab on lockdown, trapping Will and several others inside.

chapters.title: Chapter Nine: The Gate
chapters.description: Eleven makes plans to finish what she started while the survivors turn up the heat on the monstrous force that's holding Will hostage.

seasons.title: Stranger Things 3
seasons.description: Budding romance. A brand-new mall. And rabid rats running toward danger. It's the summer of 1985 in Hawkins ... and one summer can change everything.

chapters.title: Chapter One: Suzie, Do You Copy?
chapters.description: Summer brings new jobs and budding romance. But the mood shifts when Dustin's radio picks up a Russian broadcast, and Will senses something is wrong.

chapters.title: Chapter Two: The Mall Rats
chapters.description: Nancy and Jonathan follow a lead, Steve and Robin sign on to a secret mission, and Max and Eleven go shopping. A rattled Billy has troubling visions.

chapters.title: Chapter Three: The Case of the Missing Lifeguard
chapters.description: With El and Max looking for Billy, Will declares a day without girls. Steve and Dustin go on a stakeout, and Joyce and Hopper return to Hawkins Lab.

chapters.title: Chapter Four: The Sauna Test
chapters.description: A code red brings the gang back together to face a frighteningly familiar evil. Karen urges Nancy to keep digging, and Robin finds a useful map.

chapters.title: Chapter Five: The Flayed
chapters.description: Strange surprises lurk inside an old farmhouse and deep beneath the Starcourt Mall. Meanwhile, the Mind Flayer is gathering strength.

chapters.title: Chapter Six: E Pluribus Unum
chapters.description: Dr. Alexei reveals what the Russians have been building, and Eleven sees where Billy has been. Dustin and Erica stage a daring rescue.

chapters.title: Chapter Seven: The Bite
chapters.description: With time running out -- and an assassin close behind -- Hopper's crew races back to Hawkins, where El and the kids are preparing for war.

chapters.title: Chapter Eight: The Battle of Starcourt
chapters.description: Terror reigns in the food court when the Mind Flayer comes to collect. But down below, in the dark, the future of the world is at stake.

seasons.title: Stranger Things 4
seasons.description: It is a long established fact that a reader will be distracted by the readable content of a page when looking at its layout. The point of using Lorem Ipsum is that it has a more-or-less normal distribution

title: The Twilight Zone
description: A series of unrelated stories containing drama, psychological thriller, fantasy, science fiction, suspense, and/or horror, often concluding with a macabre or unexpected twist.

seasons.title: Specials
seasons.description: It is a long established fact that a reader will be distracted by the readable content of a page when looking at its layout. The point of using Lorem Ipsum is that it has a more-or-less normal distribution

chapters.title: The Time Element (pilot)
chapters.description:
A man (William Bendix) visits a psychoanalyst, complaining about a recurring dream in which he imagines waking up in Honolulu just prior to the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor.

Rod Serling wrote a teleplay intending for it to be the pilot episode of a new series called The Twilight Zone. Although it ended up airing on a different show, Westinghouse Desilu Playhouse S01E06, it is still considered the pilot episode of The Twilight Zone.

chapters.title: Interview with Rod Serling and Mike Wallace
chapters.description: "This is Mike Wallace with another television interview in our gallery of colorful people. In television drama few names have the prestige of that of our guest. Rod Serling is the only writer to have won three Emmy awards, for Requiem for a Heavyweight, Patterns and The Comedian. We'll talk to him about censorship in television, his fight to say what he believes, and we'll learn what he means by the price tag that hangs on success. We'll learn all that in just one minute."

chapters.title: Submitted For Your Approval
chapters.description: Imagine if you will, a young boy with a monstrous imagination. A lad whose fascination with sci-fi magazines and high school drama kindled a spark that would ignite into one of the brightest creative minds of this century. A young boy by the name of Rod Serling. Embark on a fascinating tour of the life of Rod Serling in this "American Masters" special. Learn the fascinating story of how television's most esteemed and popular writer outwitted stifling sponsor censorship by creating a series devoted entirely to fantasy stories--"The Twilight Zone." While censors looked elsewhere, Serling skillfully wrote "fanciful" tales that dealt with controversial issues of the day. Extensive interviews with key figures such as John Frankenheimer, Jack Klugman, Kim Hunter and Buck Houghton provide a detailed portrait of the man whose innovative work changed the course of television history.

chapters.title: Rod Serling's Lost Classics
chapters.description: This tv movie features two stories by Rod Serling, who also wrote the stories of the original "Twilight Zone" (1959) series. "The Theater": A young girl goes to the cinema to see His Girl Friday (1940) with Cary Grant. Suddenly she sees scenes from her own life instead of the comedy. The scenes actually took place earlier that day. She is very confused because the other people didn't see those scenes. As she goes to see the movie again, scenes from her future appear on the screen. And that future is very frightening... "Where the Dead Are": Dr. Benjamin Ramsey is professor at the university in Boston in 1868. In front of his students he performes an appendix operation. As the patient O'Neil dies after the operation, Dr. Ramsey discovers that O'Neil suffered from a serious scull fracture twelve years ago. Since no one could have survived such an injury, he travels to the mysterious island where O'Neil came from. There he visits Dr. Jeremy Wheaton who earlier had experimented with tissue regeneration...

chapters.title: Twilight Zone: The Movie
chapters.description: Four directors collaborated to remake four episodes of the popular television series 'The Twilight Zone' for this movie. The episodes are updated slightly and in color (the television show was in black-and-white), but very true to the originals, where eerie and disturbing situations gradually spin out of control.

chapters.title: Series pitch to sponsors
chapters.description: Rod Serling Video Pitch for his product, known as "The Twilight Zone," to the sponsors of Instant Sanka and CBS network executives giving them a preview to the strangeness, the creepiness, and the amazement of the Twilight Zone itself.

chapters.title: Suspense:
chapters.description: In the only episode of this live television anthology to be written by Rod Serling, a scientist plans his wife's untimely demise at a nuclear test site.

chapters.title: Genesee Beer Commercial  w/ Rod Serling
The Time Element (Pilot) Alternate Opening and Closing

seasons.title: Season 1
seasons.description: The first season of The Twilight Zone aired Fridays at 10:00–10:30 pm on CBS from October 2, 1959 to July 1, 1960. There are 36 episodes, including the pilot, "Where Is Everybody?". The theme music for this season, written by Bernard Herrman, is different from the music most commonly associated with the series, written by Marius Constant for the second season onwards.

chapters.title: Where Is Everybody?
chapters.description: Mike Ferris finds himself in a town strangely devoid of people. But despite the emptiness, he has the odd feeling that he's being watched...

chapters.title: One for the Angels
chapters.description: A street salesman cleverly eludes Death. But if he lives, a little girl must die in his place.

chapters.title: Mr. Denton on Doomsday
chapters.description: A has-been, drunk gunslinger finds his fast-draw abilities magically restored.

chapters.title: The Sixteen-Millimeter Shrine
chapters.description: An aging, former movie star lives and dreams in the past, constantly watching her old movies alone in her room.

chapters.title: Walking Distance
chapters.description: Martin Sloan, driving through the country, leaves his car and starts to walk toward his hometown, Homewood. He finds things exactly as they were when he was a child. He soon realizes he's gone back in time.

chapters.title: Escape Clause
chapters.description: A hypochondriac exchanges his soul for immortality and indestructibility.

chapters.title: The Lonely
chapters.description: Corry, a man stranded on an asteroid after being convicted of a crime, receives a present of a robot who looks and sounds like a real woman.

chapters.title: Time Enough at Last
chapters.description: A bank teller, obsessed with reading, finds himself alone after a nuclear blast.

chapters.title: Perchance to Dream
chapters.description: A man is terrified of falling asleep for fear he might die.

chapters.title: Judgment Night
chapters.description: In 1942, a German wonders why he's on the deck of a British steamship, with no memory of how he got there, and an overwhelming sense of impending doom.

chapters.title: And When the Sky Was Opened
chapters.description: Three astronauts have returned from this first space flight. Major Gart is hospitalized with a broken leg. The other two, Colonels Harrington and Forbes head for a bar. Harrington gets a strange feeling.

chapters.title: What You Need
chapters.description: A two-bit thug thinks he's found the key to a better life in an old sidewalk salesman who has the uncanny ability to tell people what they need the most.

chapters.title: The Four of Us Are Dying
chapters.description: A man who can change his face to resemble others gets into hot water with gangsters.

chapters.title: Third from the Sun
chapters.description: With all-out nuclear war about to ignite, a scientist and his pilot friend plot to escape on an experimental spaceship.

chapters.title: I Shot an Arrow into the Air
chapters.description: Three astronauts believe they have crashed on an asteroid.

chapters.title: The Hitch-Hiker
chapters.description: Alone on a cross-country trip, a woman continually sees the same hitch-hiker everywhere she looks.

chapters.title: The Fever
chapters.description: Tight fisted Franklin Gibbs is not pleased when his wife wins a trip for two to Las Vegas.  But things change when he falls under the spell of a slot machine that calls his name.

chapters.title: The Last Flight
chapters.description: A World War I flying ace flies through a mysterious cloud - and lands at a modern U.S. air base in the year 1959!

chapters.title: The Purple Testament
chapters.description: Lt. Fitzgerald has found his own special wartime hell.  Looking into the faces of his men prior to battle, he has the disquieting ability to see who is about to die.

chapters.title: Elegy
chapters.description: Three astronauts land on what looks like Earth 200 years before they left--only all of the people seem frozen in time.

chapters.title: Mirror Image
chapters.description: Millicent Barnes sees her double at a bus terminal.

chapters.title: The Monsters Are Due on Maple Street
