seasons.title: Season 1
seasons.description: The first season of It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia, premiered on FX on August 4, 2005. The season contains 7 episodes and concluded airing on September 15, 2005.

seasons.title: Season 2
seasons.description: The second season of It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia, premiered on FX on June 29, 2006. The season contains 10 episodes and concluded airing on August 17, 2006.

chapters.title: Charlie Gets Crippled
chapters.description: An accident that puts Charlie in a wheelchair opens up a window of possibilities for the gang. Meanwhile, Dennis and Dee’s estranged father reenters their life in hopes of starting anew with his children and soon discovers that he enjoys the lifestyle of their friends.

chapters.title: The Gang Goes Jihad
chapters.description: When the gang learns that they are in danger of losing their bar due to a zoning mishap, they resort to some outlandish and extreme methods to prevent that from happening. Meanwhile, Frank isn’t too happy when his wife returns to town.

chapters.title: Dennis and Dee Go on Welfare
chapters.description: After quitting their job due to Frank's continuing interference, Dennis and Dee decide to seek alternative income by going on welfare. Meanwhile, Mac and Charlie must now bear the consequences of their friends’ departures from the business.

chapters.title: Mac Bangs Dennis' Mom
chapters.description: Barbara hooks up with Mac to make Frank jealous, which leads to retaliation from Dennis.

chapters.title: Hundred Dollar Baby
chapters.description: Frank runs into an old adversary at the gym when he begins teaching Dee to box after she was robbed. Hoping to make some extra money on the side, Mac and Dennis make preparations for Charlie to compete in an underground street fighting match.

chapters.title: The Gang Gives Back
chapters.description: After being arrested for arson the gang is sentenced to do community service. Frank makes an effort to connect more with Dennis. Meanwhile, Charlie is also ordered to attend AA where he makes a startling discovery that might be beneficial in his ongoing quest to hook up with the Waitress.

chapters.title: The Gang Exploits A Miracle
chapters.description: Mac and Dee become uncomfortable when the rest of the guys decide to make some extra money by exploiting the similarities between a water stain and the Virgin Mary. A reunion with someone from the past, stirs up forbidden feelings within Dee.

chapters.title: The Gang Runs for Office
chapters.description: Driven by Frank's insight into the world of politics, Dennis pursues a political career by running for office.

chapters.title: Charlie Goes America All Over Everybody's Ass
chapters.description: Dennis and Mac make a decision to take away all rules concerning moral and behavioral etiquette at Paddy's after an argument about the Constitution. Frank uses the decision and it's following consequences to his own gain. Meanwhile, Charlie tries to convey his love for America by protesting while Dee attempts to reaffirm her goal of being an actress.

chapters.title: Dennis and Dee Get a New Dad
chapters.description: Dee receives e-mails from a stranger claiming to be her and Dennis' real father. Meanwhile, Mac decides to visit his father who is in prison.

seasons.title: Season 3
seasons.description: The third season of It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia, premiered on FX on September 13, 2007. The season contains 15 episodes and concluded airing on November 15, 2007.

chapters.title: The Gang Finds A Dumpster Baby
chapters.description: Dennis joins up with an environmentalist group, but his altruistic intentions quickly sour when he's snubbed by the activists. Dee and Mac decide to raise a baby they find in the dumpster, but quickly find out that it's not nearly as fun as they thought it would be, and Frank and Charlie take the concept of recycling a bit too far.

chapters.title: The Gang Gets Invincible
chapters.description: Mac, Dennis and Dee try out for the Philadelphia Eagles.  Also interested in becoming an Eagle is Liam and Ryan McPoyle's brother, Doyle.

chapters.title: Dennis and Dee's Mom Is Dead
chapters.description: After Barbara's death, Dee and Frank are unhappy to learn that she left them both out of the will, while Dennis inherits the mansion which he plans to turn into a party pad.

chapters.title: The Gang Gets Held Hostage
chapters.description: The McPoyles hold the entire gang hostage at Paddys while Frank is busy searching for his will in the air ducts.

chapters.title: The Aluminum Monster vs. Fatty Magoo
chapters.description: Dee is shocked to learn that an overweight social outcast from her High School has become a rich and skinny fashion designer.

chapters.title: The Gang Solves the North Korea Situation
chapters.description: A Korean restaurant owner threatens to get Paddy's kicked off the route for the city's annual pub crawl. The gang's response: War.

chapters.title: The Gang Sells Out
chapters.description: The gang agrees to sell Paddys when they get an offer that is too good to refuse, but it forces the bar's non-partners, Dee and Charlie to find new jobs.

chapters.title: Frank Sets Sweet Dee On Fire
chapters.description: Mac teams up with Frank and Charlie to create a public access newscast after he misses his chance at fame in the news. Meanwhile, Dennis and Dee try to make it big in the club scene.

chapters.title: Sweet Dee's Dating a Retarded Person
chapters.description: Dee gets involved with a famous local rapper who might be mentally challenged, and whose success inspires the rest of the gang to start a band.

chapters.title: Mac Is a Serial Killer
chapters.description: After Mac arrives to the bar with scratches on his neck and exhibiting strange behavior, Frank comes to the conclusion that he is the serial killer terrorizing young women in Philadelphia. Frank sets out with his trusty chainsaw and a doubtful Charlie to find evidence to implicate Mac in the murders. In search of another suspect, Dennis and Dee do a little role-playing in order to help themselves better understand who they might be dealing with.

chapters.title: Dennis Looks Like a Registered Sex Offender
chapters.description: When Dennis is mistaken for a recently released child molester, he is more bothered by the fact that the guy is overweight rather than him being a sex offender.  Meanwhile, Mac tries once again to bond with his ex-con father, who shows an interest in Dee.

chapters.title: The Gang Gets Whacked: Part 1
chapters.description: After stumbling upon a kilo of cocaine, the gang is forced to pay off a $25,000 debt to the mob. Mac becomes a mob informant, while Frank pimps out Dennis as an escort at the local country club. Charlie stumbles upon an opportunity to sell illegal narcotics.

chapters.title: The Gang Gets Whacked: Part 2
chapters.description: While paying off their debt to the mob, Charlie and Dee try to find a way to make fake cocaine in order to fool them, while Dennis ranks in thousands of dollars being pimped out at the local country club. Mac realizes his position as a mob informant isn't being utilized to its full potential.

chapters.title: Bums: Making a Mess All Over the City
chapters.description: Mac and Dee become vigilantes in order to remove the homeless from their neighborhood, while Frank and Dennis impersonate police officers.

chapters.title: The Gang Dances Their Asses Off
chapters.description: In the season finale, Charlie accidentally puts Paddy's up as a prize for a dance marathon, which prompts the gang to enter the competition in order to save their bar.

seasons.title: Season 4
seasons.description: The fourth season of It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia, premiered on FX on September 18, 2008. The season contains 13 episodes and concluded airing on November 20, 2008.

chapters.title: Mac and Dennis: Manhunters
chapters.description: Charlie and Dee have been stealing Frank's delicious meats, so Frank leaves out human meat to get back at them. Driven by their cannibalistic needs, Charlie and Dee go in search of human flesh. Mac and Dennis harass Frank for hunting defenseless animals and think it would be much more badass to hunt something that could fight back ... like a human.

chapters.title: The Gang Solves the Gas Crisis
chapters.description: Charlie, Mac, and Dennis formulate a plan to take advantage of the rising gas prices. By purchasing excess amounts now, they can sell it in the future and profit. As usual, things don't go as planned. Dee is also out to make money when she learns that Bruce is going to give the family fortune to a Muslim cultural center. She and Frank try to stop him and get the cash for themselves.

chapters.title: America’s Next Top Paddy’s Billboard Model Contest
chapters.description: Due to the gang's latest "business expenses," Paddy's is in dire need of money. Frank buys a billboard to advertise the bar, but Dee decides to create a viral video to post on YouTube for promotion. Charlie quickly joins her, leaving Frank and Mac to hold a contest for some hot models to feature on the billboard. Naturally, Dennis joins the competition to prove his worth.

chapters.title: Mac’s Banging the Waitress
chapters.description: Charlie finds out that the waitress has been seeing someone. He calls on Mac, his so-called best friend, to find out more information about the guy and to beat him up. However, it turns out that Mac is the guy the waitress has supposedly been seeing. Dennis, heartbroken that he's not Charlie's best friend, tries to win him over.

chapters.title: Mac and Charlie Die: Part One
chapters.description: Part 1 of 2. Mac and Charlie fake their deaths to avoid the wrath of Mac's father who was released from prison and is out for vengeance.

chapters.title: Mac and Charlie Die: Part Two
chapters.description: Part 2 of 2. Dennis, Frank, and Dee find unique ways of coping with the apparent loss of their friends.

chapters.title: Who Pooped the Bed?
chapters.description: Charlie and Frank awake to find poop in their bed. Neither will confess to being the owner, so they, Mac, and Dennis try to scientifically deduce who dropped the deuce. Dee wants to do something a bit more sophisticated, so she invites the waitress and Artemis to a girls' night out.

chapters.title: Paddy’s Pub: The Worst Bar in Philadelphia
chapters.description: A newspaper critic is kidnapped by the gang after he calls Paddy's pub the worst bar in Philadelphia.

chapters.title: Dennis Reynolds: An Erotic Life
chapters.description: After discovering Dennis' erotic memoir, Mac and Frank attempt to make some money off of it. Meanwhile, Dee and Charlie decide to spend a day in each other's shoes.

chapters.title: Sweet Dee Has a Heart Attack
chapters.description: After Dee suffers a heart attack, she and Dennis try to live a healthier lifestyle. Meanwhile, Charlie and Mac take corporate jobs to get health insurance.

chapters.title: The Gang Cracks the Liberty Bell
chapters.description: The gang fudge history by claiming that Paddy's Pub was responsible for cracking the Liberty Bell in an attempt to turn their dive into a Philadelphia landmark.

chapters.title: The Gang Gets Extreme: Home Makeover Edition
chapters.description: Hoping to make their own dreams come true, the gang sets out to give an unexpected family an extreme home makeover.

chapters.title: The Nightman Cometh
chapters.description: In the season finale, Charlie gets the gang to help him put together a rock opera based on his song "Nightman."

seasons.title: Season 5
seasons.description: The fifth season of It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia, premiered on FX on September 17, 2009. The season contains 12 episodes and concluded airing on December 10, 2009.

chapters.title: The Gang Exploits the Mortgage Crisis
chapters.description: Dennis, Mac, and Frank go into real estate, while Dee sets out to be a surrogate for a wealthy couple. Charlie gets into it with an attorney over the law.

chapters.title: The Gang Hits the Road
chapters.description: The gang tries to expand their horizons by going on a road trip to the Grand Canyon.

chapters.title: The Great Recession
chapters.description: With a shantytown taking shape outside, Mac and Dennis try to keep Paddy's going in tough times. Meanwhile, Frank and Dee start a family business.

chapters.title: The Gang Gives Frank an Intervention
chapters.description: Frank's behavior is more bizarre than usual---so bizarre that even the gang notice---so they decide to stage an intervention.

chapters.title: The Waitress Is Getting Married
chapters.description: The waitress is getting married, Dee is jealous that she's beating her to the altar, so she tries to derail the wedding.

chapters.title: The World Series Defense
chapters.description: The gang describes the trials and tribulations they went through, during game five of the World Series, in hopes the judge will clear them of all the citations they received.

chapters.title: The Gang Wrestles for the Troops
chapters.description: The gang puts together a wrestling show for returning troops. Meanwhile, Dee finally meets the soldier that she has been communicating with over the internet.

chapters.title: Paddy's Pub: Home of the Original Kitten Mittens
chapters.description: The gang decides to expand their business by developing a number of products that they could sell at Paddy's pub.

chapters.title: Mac and Dennis Break Up
chapters.description: Mac and Dennis decide that they need to spend some time away from each other. Meanwhile, Charlie helps Dee search for her cat.

chapters.title: The D.E.N.N.I.S. System
chapters.description: Dennis reveals his foolproof system for seducing any woman to the rest of the gang, but they don't grasp the concept.

chapters.title: Mac and Charlie Write a Movie
chapters.description: When Dee gets a part in the new M. Night Shyamalan film, Mac and Charlie seize a chance to pitch their movie script.

chapters.title: The Gang Reignites the Rivalry
chapters.description: After being banned for 10 years from a local drinking competition appropriately named "Flipadelphia," the gang tries to reignite their old rivalry with another local bar. Finding that they are in need of some serious practice, the guys head to Dennis' old fraternity house at the University of Pennsylvania to get their game up to speed while Dee hones her skills on her own. Frank wears skinny pants.

seasons.title: Season 6
seasons.description: The sixth season of It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia, premiered on FX on September 16, 2010. The season contains 14 episodes and concluded airing on December 9, 2010 with the hour-long Christmas special. An additional episode called "The Gang Gets Successful" was produced for this season, but was not aired, despite scenes from the episode being included in promotional material for season 6. It was later re-edited with new scenes to create the Season 7 episode "How Mac Got Fat".

chapters.title: Mac Fights Gay Marriage
chapters.description: Mac defends traditional marriage, while the rest of the gang reaps the rewards of wedded bliss.

chapters.title: Dennis Gets Divorced
chapters.description: Marital bliss turns into business, as the gang experiences the emotional and economic hardships of divorce.

chapters.title: The Gang Buys a Boat
chapters.description: The gang attempts to find adventure on the sea after they purchase their 'new' boat.

chapters.title: Mac's Big Break
chapters.description: Mac finally gets his big break after correctly answering a trivia question on the radio. While Frank, Dennis, and Dee take their bar-banter to the internet with their own podcast.

chapters.title: Mac and Charlie: White Trash
chapters.description: Rejected from a pool club, Mac and Charlie set out fix an abandoned pool to help cope with the Philly heat wave. Meanwhile, Dennis and Dee go about dealing with the heat in a different way.

chapters.title: Mac's Mom Burns Her House Down
chapters.description: Mac's mother is left homeless after she burns down her house, which leaves Charlie and Mac with no choice but to make new living arrangements; when Dee feels under the weather, Frank tries to muster his paternal instincts to care for her.

chapters.title: Who Got Dee Pregnant
chapters.description: The gang gets a real scare after Dee reveals she's pregnant, forcing the guys to recall their last hazy Halloween party to determine who the father is.

chapters.title: The Gang Gets a New Member
chapters.description: A blast from the past prompts the guys to expand membership, and Dee to re-consider her future.

chapters.title: Dee Reynolds: Shaping America's Youth
chapters.description: Motivated by the drama teacher who inspired her, Dee takes a job as a substitute teacher, and exposes her students to the culture of Paddy's with a field trip to see the Gang's take on the Lethal Weapon series: Lethal Weapon 5.

chapters.title: Charlie Kelly: King of the Rats
chapters.description: Keeping the basement rodent-free drives Charlie to the brink. The gang throws Charlie a surprise party.

chapters.title: The Gang Gets Stranded in the Woods
chapters.description: En route to Atlantic City for a charity event, Mac, Frank and Dee get lost. Meanwhile, Dennis and Charlie hitch a ride to town.

chapters.title: Dee Gives Birth
chapters.description: Dee's blessed event is fast approaching but the father's identity remains a mystery---to the gang, at least. So they throw a party and invite all of Dee's former flings.

chapters.title: A Very Sunny Christmas
chapters.description: After years of being mistreated by Frank during the holiday season, Dennis and Dee decide to teach him a lesson. Meanwhile, Mac and Charlie reflect on their childhood Christmases, and realize that they were not as joyous and wonderful as they remembered.

seasons.title: Season 7
seasons.description: The seventh season of It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia, premiered on FX on September 15, 2011. The season contained 13 episodes, and concluded airing on December 15, 2011. The episode "How Mac Got Fat" includes scenes produced during season 6 that featured Mac, before he got fat.

chapters.title: Frank's Pretty Woman
chapters.description: With Frank intent on marrying a prostitute, The Gang tries to make the best of it by attempting an image makeover to uncover the heart of gold that exists deep inside Frank’s “pretty woman.”

chapters.title: The Gang Goes to the Jersey Shore
chapters.description: Dee and Dennis take the gang to their favorite childhood vacation spot where things aren't quite how they remember. While Dee and Dennis see the seedy side of the Jersey Shore, Mac, Frank and Charlie have the nights of their lives.

chapters.title: Frank Reynolds' Little Beauties
chapters.description: Frank finds himself in the child beauty-pageant business and fears that people might think that he's in it for the wrong reasons. Meanwhile, Dee wages war on stage moms, and Mac, Dennis and Charlie think they have found a contestant to back.

chapters.title: Sweet Dee Gets Audited
chapters.description: Dee faces an IRS audit over her claim that the baby she carried as a surrogate is her dependent, while the guys decide to run the bar in an unemotional, democratic manner rather than their typical method of shouting and personal attacks.

chapters.title: Frank's Brother
chapters.description: When Frank's long lost brother Gino shows up at the bar, the two of them tell the gang about the jazz club they ran in the 1960s and 70s, and how they fell out over Shadynasty, a singer who was the love of both of their lives.

chapters.title: The Storm of the Century
chapters.description: As a hurricane threatens Philadelphia, Mac, Dennis and Charlie go to a mall to buy supplies and check out the large breasted TV reporter broadcasting from there, while Frank and Dee prepare Paddy's, and its basement bunker, for the storm.

chapters.title: Chardee MacDennis: The Game of Games
chapters.description: The gang plays the most twisted board game ever. Dee and Dennis face Mac, Charlie and Frank.

chapters.title: The ANTI-Social Network
chapters.description: The gang uses the Internet to cyber-stalk their prey. Frank tries to drum up business for Paddy's with a viral video.

chapters.title: The Gang Gets Trapped
chapters.description: The Gang's plan to "extract" an "artifact" from a residence is jeopardized when the owners turn out to be home. Having not been noticed on the way in, they must make a plan to get the same result for the way out.

chapters.title: How Mac Got Fat
chapters.description: Step inside the confession booth with Mac as he tells a befuddled priest why his fatness is the fault of the other members of The Gang.

chapters.title: Thunder Gun Express
chapters.description: Traffic problems as a result of the President's visit to Philadelphia makes it difficult for the gang to see the summer's biggest film, "Thunder Gun Express".

chapters.title: The High School Reunion (1)
chapters.description: The gang have much to prove when they attend their high-school reunion. They meet old friends and make new foes as they stroll down memory lane.

chapters.title: The High School Reunion Part 2: The Gang's Revenge (2)
chapters.description: The gang come up with a new plan to buff their tarnished high-school reputations at their reunion.

seasons.title: Season 8
seasons.description: The eighth season of It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia, premiered on FX on October 11, 2012. This season consisted of 10 episodes, and concluded airing on December 20, 2012.

chapters.title: Pop-Pop: The Final Solution
chapters.description: Dennis and Dee's ailing grandfather Pop-Pop is wasting away in the hospital, and they have to decide whether or not to pull the plug. But things get complicated when The Gang learns of Pop-Pop's history as a Nazi, and Mac, Charlie and Frank set off in search of the old man's spoils from the war.

chapters.title: The Gang Recycles Their Trash
chapters.description: With the garbage men of Philadelphia on strike, Frank concocts a plan to undercut the union and get the contract to collect the city's trash.

chapters.title: The Maureen Ponderosa Wedding Massacre
chapters.description: The gang make a disturbing discovery after crashing Maureen's wedding.

chapters.title: Charlie and Dee Find Love
chapters.description: Charlie and Dee become romantically involved with two members of a wealthy family, which arouses jealousy in Mac, Dennis and Frank.

chapters.title: The Gang Gets Analyzed
chapters.description: The Gang gets Freudian as they step into the therapist's office to work through their mountain of issues, but when Dennis thinks he has everyone figured out, the shrink turns the tables on him and exposes the insanity in his unique brand of pop psychology.

chapters.title: Charlie's Mom Has Cancer
chapters.description: Mac, Charlie and Dee struggle with their faith as Charlie's mom fights cancer. Meanwhile, Frank loses his memory amidst a search for buried treasure.

chapters.title: Frank's Back in Business
chapters.description: With Charlie under his wing, Frank cleans up so he can get his hands dirty and help out his old company with one last big merger. An unwritten rule of the bar gets the rest of the gang caught up in a case of mistaken identity.

chapters.title: Charlie Rules the World
chapters.description: After slipping into an unhealthy obsession with computer games, The Gang wrestles to define the difference between the real and the virtual worlds.

chapters.title: The Gang Dines Out
chapters.description: Every member of The Gang has something to celebrate at Guigino's, Philly's finest eatery, but when Mac and Dennis' private dinner is interrupted by an unexpected sighting of Frank and Charlie, the in-fighting begins. Dee also turns up at a table for one, and over the course of the night, the "one-ups-manship" soars to new heights.

chapters.title: Reynolds vs. Reynolds: The Cereal Defense
chapters.description: Court is in session at Paddy's Pub as Frank and Dennis present their cases to the rest of the gang, resulting in a verdict that will change their lives FOREVER... but not really.

seasons.title: Season 9
seasons.description: The ninth season of It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia, premiered on FXX on September 4, 2013. This season consisted of 10 episodes, and concluded airing on November 6, 2013.

chapters.title: The Gang Broke Dee
chapters.description: The gang attempts to cheer up a deeply depressed Dee, realizing they are the cause for her predicament.

chapters.title: Gun Fever Too: Still Hot
chapters.description: After Frank appears on Local Television advocating gun ownership, the rest of the gang takes a look at the ownership process and alternatives to find a common ground on this still heated issue.

chapters.title: The Gang Tries Desperately to Win an Award
chapters.description: Tired of failing to be recognized for their years of service in the bar industry, the gang changes their ways to give the patrons what they think they want.

chapters.title: Mac and Dennis Buy a Timeshare
chapters.description: The gang does their best to recoup their investments in questionable schemes by dumping their losses on Ben the soldier while trying to avoid being duped again by whatever mastermind is pulling their strings.

chapters.title: Mac Day
chapters.description: Everyone in the gang gets a day to do what they want while everyone else in the gang must participate willingly. This is Mac's Day... and its got twice the "Mac".

chapters.title: The Gang Saves the Day
chapters.description: A routine trip to a convenience store places the gang in the middle of an armed robbery.

chapters.title: The Gang Gets Quarantined
chapters.description: The gang voluntarily quarantine themselves inside of Paddy's in an attempt to keep their singing voices pristine for an upcoming competition when a severe flu outbreak sweeps Philadelphia.

chapters.title: Flowers for Charlie
chapters.description: When an experiment successfully multiplies Charlie's intellect and takes him away from the bar, the rest of the gang find themselves struggling to complete the menial "Charlie Work" that has kept the bar running for so long.

chapters.title: The Gang Makes Lethal Weapon 6
chapters.description: After creative differences over what constitutes tasteful nudity cause Frank to pull his money out of "Lethal Weapon 6" during filming, Mac, Dennis, and Charlie screen their rough footage for investors in hopes of raising enough capital to finish the production of their latest masterpiece.

chapters.title: The Gang Squashes Their Beefs
chapters.description: When some bad blood with old foes compromises their ideal Thanksgiving, the gang decides to make amends by breaking bread with those they've hurt.

seasons.title: Season 10
seasons.description: The tenth season of It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia, premiered on FXX on January 14, 2015. This season consisted of 10 episodes, and concluded airing on March 18, 2015.

chapters.title: The Gang Beats Boggs
chapters.description: Mac oversees the gang while they compete to break Wade Boggs’ legendary beer drinking record.

chapters.title: The Gang Group Dates
chapters.description: The gang gets into the online dating scene to expand their matchmaking potential.

chapters.title: Psycho Pete Returns
chapters.description: When Psycho Pete, long lost member of the freight train, is released from the mental hospital, Dennis and Dee rush to get him recommitted while Charlie and Mac attempt to restore him to his former hard-partying form.

chapters.title: Charlie Work
chapters.description: Charlie goes into overdrive when he's notified that the health inspector will be arriving that day. Meanwhile, the rest of the gang is trying to exploit a flaw in the air-miles reward system. Written by David Hornsby; directed by Matt Shakman.

chapters.title: The Gang Spies Like U.S.
chapters.description: Dennis and Mac enlist Dee to spy on the fish factory across the street, Charlie and Frank grow suspicious and decide to do some spying of their own. Written by David Hornsby; directed by Matt Shakman.

chapters.title: The Gang Misses the Boat
chapters.description: The group separates from one another to find out who they are as individuals after another failed endeavor.

chapters.title: Mac Kills His Dad
chapters.description: News surfaces about Mac's Dad, Luther, being a murder suspect. Mac goes into full "P.I." mode to clear his father of any wrong doing.

chapters.title: The Gang Goes on Family Fight
chapters.description: When the gang appears on a nationally broadcasted game show, Dennis does his best to keep the gang’s weirdness under wraps.

chapters.title: Frank Retires
chapters.description: Frank decides to retire; the foursome begin to plot and plan ways for each of them to take control of the bar.

chapters.title: Ass Kickers United: Mac and Charlie Join a Cult
chapters.description: "Asskickers" isn't just a hot new way to work out; it's a way of life...and maybe a cult.

seasons.title: Season 11
seasons.description: The eleventh season of It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia, premiered on FXX on January 6, 2016. This season consisted of 10 episodes, and concluded airing on March 9, 2016.

chapters.title: Chardee MacDennis 2: Electric Boogaloo
chapters.description: The gang agrees to a truce while demonstrating Chardee MacDennis for an interested board game executive, but the nature of the game quickly sends things off the rails

chapters.title: Frank Falls Out the Window
chapters.description: Frank falls out the window causing him to think it's 2006, the gang approaches it as a do-over and attempts to fix their past mistakes.

chapters.title: The Gang Hits the Slopes
chapters.description: Dennis and Frank square off against Dee and Mac for control of the mountain, while Charlie learns that the slopes have their own set of rules.

chapters.title: Dee Made a Smut Film
chapters.description: Dennis and Dee film an adaptation of Dennis' erotic memoirs while Frank and Mac try to pass off Charlie as a gifted artist for financial gain.

chapters.title: Mac & Dennis Move to the Suburbs
Being Frank
chapters.description: The gang have a new scheme and Frank tries to keep up.

chapters.title: McPoyle vs. Ponderosa: The Trial of the Century
chapters.description: Old grievances bubble to the surface when The Lawyer agrees to sue Bill Ponderosa on behalf of the Liam McPoyle and his lost eye.

chapters.title: Charlie Catches a Leprechaun
chapters.description: Dennis tries to create an innovative mobile Paddy's pub experience but runs into trouble when customers refuse to cooperate, while Charlie and Mac attempt to catch a thieving leprechaun.

chapters.title: The Gang Goes to Hell
chapters.description: The gang tries to take a vacation from their usual dynamic by going on a cruise, but old habits die hard.

chapters.title: The Gang Goes to Hell: Part Two

seasons.title: Season 12
seasons.description: In season twelve, Mac, Dennis, Charlie, Dee and Frank tackle all new adventures that include going to a waterpark, dealing with a Wolf Cola PR nightmare, and actually spending a whole day tending bar!

chapters.title: The Gang Turns Black
chapters.description: After an electric heating blanket shorts out while the gang watches the Wiz they look in the mirror and realize they've turned black. They have to figure out how to get back to being themselves by going through all the classic body switch movie shenanigans they encounter.

chapters.title: The Gang Goes to a Water Park
chapters.description: The gang takes a trip to a local waterpark. Dennis takes on a protégé. Frank and Charlie are determined to ride every ride. Mac and Dee get stuck in a tube slide.

chapters.title: Old Lady House: A Situation Comedy
chapters.description: Charlie thinks Mac's mom is holding his mom hostage so the gang installs spy cameras in their house. They discover the moms are quite entertaining once Dennis makes edits to the footage.

chapters.title: Wolf Cola: A Public Relations Nightmare
chapters.description: Franks Fluids LLC is in big trouble after a news segment. Dee and Dennis help with the PR nightmare and Charlie and Mac work on a scheme to make Fight Milk the official drink of the UFC.

chapters.title: Making Dennis Reynolds a Murderer
chapters.description: A cat-woman is killed and Dennis becomes the main suspect.

chapters.title: Hero or Hate Crime?
chapters.description: The gang fight over a lottery ticket and seek out an arbitrator to decide a rightful owner, who also decides if Frank is a hero or hate monger.

chapters.title: PTSDee
chapters.description: Dee dates a male stripper and tries to prove her worth after learning she's his "rock bottom." Elsewhere: Mac and Frank get sucked into a VR war game, leading Mac to develop a case PTSD.

chapters.title: The Gang Tends Bar
chapters.description: It’s Valentine’s Day and Paddy’s is packed with customers. Dennis implores the gang to do one day of actual work but everyone else is distracted by a mystery crate Cricket spotted in the alley. Eventually, the gang becomes convinced Dennis really wants them to work on their relationships and everyone shares their grievances without much resolution.

chapters.title: A Cricket's Tale
chapters.description: We get to see a typical day in Cricket's world and then a possible redemption when his family intervenes. Will Cricket finally move on from the gang, finding love in the process? Will Cricket go from filthy beast to his former self, Matthew Mara?

chapters.title: Dennis' Double Life
chapters.description: Dennis reveals he has a baby after his Wade Boggs layover in North Dakota and the gang try to help him get out of the jam, but their suggestions border on the extreme.

seasons.title: Season 13
seasons.description: The Gang returns... mostly... in Season 13. Mac, Charlie, Dee, and Frank return to their duplicitous, scheming ways at Paddy’s Pub, while Dennis takes on the new role of father in North Dakota. Even without Dennis, the Gang has its hands full as Charlie hopes to have a child with The Waitress, Mac sets out to understand his newfound sexuality, Dee takes feminism to new heights, and Frank goes to great lengths for the Gang to experience the greatest moment in Philadelphia sports history – an Eagles Super Bowl victory.

chapters.title: The Gang Makes Paddy's Great Again
chapters.description: Meet Cindy, the new, ethnically diverse female member of the gang who can successfully pull off scams. Everything is working until Mac introduces a new member: a life-like sex doll that looks exactly like Dennis.

chapters.title: The Gang Escapes
chapters.description: To boost productivity, Dee hires an at-home "Escape Room Experience" service to come to Dennis and Mac's apartment. Will they escape? Who will get the credit? What could go wrong?

chapters.title: The Gang Beats Boggs: Ladies Reboot
chapters.description: To one-up the guys, Dee has organized an "all-female reboot" of the Wade Boggs challenge on a first-of-its-kind, all-female flight headed to L.A. for the women's march.

chapters.title: Time's Up For The Gang
chapters.description: Paddy's has been put on a list of bars that are sexually hostile to women, and the gang must attend a sexual harassment seminar to get off the list.

chapters.title: The Gang Gets New Wheels
chapters.description: Dee gets in with a group of cool, rich housewives. Dennis hits it off with some everyday blue-collar bros. Frank struggles to renew his license, and Charlie and Mac deal with a new generation of bicycle bullies.

chapters.title: The Gang Solves The Bathroom Problem
chapters.description: Jimmy Buffett is in town and the positive vibes are alive at the bar. But when Mac comes out of the women's bathroom, no one can leave until the bathroom situation is solved.

chapters.title: The Gang Does A Clip Show
chapters.description: With nothing to do while their phones update to the latest software, the gang decides to reminisce on old times. As everyone misremembers events from their past, the gang's current reality becomes altered.

chapters.title: Charlie's Home Alone
chapters.description: It's the weekend of Super Bowl LII from Charlie's perspective. While Charlie searches the back office, Cricket steals the suit leaving Charlie home alone to defend himself.

chapters.title: The Gang Wins the Big Game
chapters.description: It’s the most important weekend of their lives and Frank has treated the gang and a crew of their ragtag hangers-on with tickets to see the Eagles in the Super Bowl!

chapters.title: Mac Finds His Pride
chapters.description: Frank tries to recruit Mac for the gang’s kickass float for the Gay Pride Parade. It dawns on Frank that Mac will never be secure with his sexual identity unless he comes out to his father.

seasons.title: Season 14
seasons.description: The 14th season guns for the Best 14th Season accolade as the Gang goes to extremes for the role – Mac learns a new language, Charlie does a period piece, Dennis attempts a one-act play, Dee cuts her hair, and Frank performs a death scene.

chapters.title: The Gang Gets Romantic
chapters.description: Mac concocts a scheme to attract single women to Airbnb Dennis' bedroom, while Frank and Charlie concoct similar plans to attract young, European coeds. But neither ad attracts their intended target.

chapters.title: Thunder Gun 4: Maximum Cool
chapters.description: The Gang finds themselves in the middle of a focus group after a screening of Thunder Gun 4: Maximum Cool. They are determined to restore glory and traditional American values back into the franchise, even if it involves sabotage.

chapters.title: Dee Day
chapters.description: The Guys are in the final preparation stage for an unknown scheme when Dee excitedly enters to inform them that today is “Dee Day.” The guys have to do everything she wants without complaint.

chapters.title: The Gang Chokes
chapters.description: Annoyed that the Gang failed to react as he nearly choked to death on an appetizer, Frank decides the Waiter, his savior, is the only person who has his back.

chapters.title: The Gang Texts
chapters.description: During their trip to the Philadelphia Zoo, Mac sets up a text group chain for The Gang, but confusion sets in and The Gang must learn from the meerkats on how to communicate properly in a group.

chapters.title: The Janitor Always Mops Twice
chapters.description: In the black-and-white noir world of his memory, Charlie navigates the seedy underbelly of Philadelphia as Frank has been "diarrhea poisoned," and it's up to Charlie to clean up the mess.

chapters.title: The Gang Solves Global Warming
chapters.description: As a record-breaking heat wave overtakes Philly, the Gang plans to profit from global warming by pumping up the A/C so people will congregate at Paddy's and save energy at home.

chapters.title: Paddy's Has a Jumper
chapters.description: Trapped inside Paddy's with a suicide jumper on the roof, the Gang wonders if they should bother intervening with an algorithm of their own - Could he, would he, should we? the second half hour, Dennis and Charlie stand guard at the entrance to their laser tag base waiting to ambush the legendary "Big Mo," but Dennis begins to ponder the reasons they play laser tag and if their pursuit of a victory is worth their effort.

chapters.title: A Woman's Right to Chop
chapters.description: When a trendy new hair salon opens up right next door to Paddy's, Dennis and Frank go on the offensive to stop women from cutting off their hair. Meanwhile, Mac is reunited with his childhood dog Poppins..

chapters.title: Waiting for Big Mo
chapters.description: In this spoof of Waiting for Godot, Dennis and Charlie stand guard at their laser tag base waiting to ambush their enemy, Big Mo, but Dennis has doubts about why they play laser tag and whether or not the victory is worth it.

title: Neon Genesis Evangelion
description: At the turn of the century, the Angels returned to Earth, seeking to wipe out humanity in an apocalyptic fury. Devastated, mankind's last remnants moved underground to wait for the day when the Angels would come back to finish the job. Fifteen years later, that day has come... but this time, humanity is ready to fight back with terrifying bio-mechanical weapons known as the Evangelions. Watch as Shinji, Rei, Asuka and the rest of the mysterious shadow agency Nerv battle to save earth from total annihilation.

seasons.title: Specials
seasons.description: It is a long established fact that a reader will be distracted by the readable content of a page when looking at its layout. The point of using Lorem Ipsum is that it has a more-or-less normal distribution

chapters.title: Death and Rebirth
chapters.description: Originally a collection of clips from the Neon Genesis Evangelion TV series, Death was created as a precursor to the re-worked ending of the series. Rebirth was intended as that reworked ending but after production overruns became only the first half of the first episode of The End of Evangelion, with some minor differences. Over time, two newer director`s cuts of Death were produced, each including new footage not seen in the series - these were called Death (True) and finally Death (True)^2. Note that despite containing clips from the series, Death (True)^2 & Rebirth should be seen after the series itself to be fully understood.

chapters.title: The End of Evangelion: Concurrency Project
The End of Evangelion
chapters.description:
An alternate ending to the series complementing episodes 25 and 26, the film combines the two episodes:

"Air" (Love is Destructive) and

"My Purest Heart for You" (One More Final: I need you)

With the Angels defeated, Commander Gendo Ikari and Seele finally break their relationship and Gendo attempts to start Third Impact with Rei and the Angel Lilith in Terminal Dogma.

chapters.title: Evangelion 1.0: You Are (Not) Alone
chapters.description: The plot is for largely a point-for-point adaptation of episodes 1 through 6 of the original Evangelion series. While some events are portrayed in exactly the same way, often using the same storyboards from the television show, albeit newly redrawn; other events unfold differently, using new storyboards and/or 3D computer animation. Most notably, the fifth angel Ramiel, and the fight against him, has gone through a complete redesign.

chapters.title: Evangelion 2.0: You Can (Not) Advance
chapters.description: Evangelion: 2.0 You Can (Not) Advance continues the story of Shinji Ikari, who has chosen a path of struggle and combat against the mysterious and awesomely powerful beings known as Angels. Joined by Asuka, Rei and a previously unknown heroine by the name of Mari, the true purpose behind NERV, SEELE, the Angels, and the looming apocalypse begin to be revealed…

chapters.title: Evangelion 3.0: You Can (Not) Redo
chapters.description: The third movie in the Rebuild of Evangelion series.

chapters.title: Neon Genesis Evangelion: Symphonic Orchestra Live
chapters.description: The video live release of the double-CD symphonic recorded in Bunkamura Orchard Hall in 1997.

seasons.title: Season 1
seasons.description: It is a long established fact that a reader will be distracted by the readable content of a page when looking at its layout. The point of using Lorem Ipsum is that it has a more-or-less normal distribution

chapters.title: Angel Attack
chapters.description: Shinji Ikari is summoned to Tokyo-3 by his estranged father Gendo, commander of the special agency NERV, to defend the city from a giant Angel by piloting the only weapon capable of battling the monster: Evangelion Unit-01.

chapters.title: The Beast
chapters.description: Shinji wakes up in the hospital, with no memory of defeating the Angel the night before. Rejected by his father, Misato decides to take Shinji with her to live in her apartment. Later that night, memories of the battle against the Angel come flooding back to Shinji.

chapters.title: A Transfer
chapters.description: Shinji begins attending his new school in Tokyo-3, and has a difficult time dealing with the fame of being an Evangelion pilot. Touji Suzuhara, who's little sister was injured in Shinji's fight against the Angel, is angry at Shinji. A new Angel appears, and Shinji must once again pilot EVA-01 to defeat it.

chapters.title: Hedgehog's Dilemma
chapters.description: Misato is upset with Shinji for ignoring her orders in the last Angel battle, and he is so overcome by the stress of being an EVA pilot that he runs away. After wandering around Tokyo-3 for several days, Shinji is faced with the choice of quitting or staying in his new home.

chapters.title: Rei (1)
chapters.description: EVA-00 is finally repaired, and Shinji tries to get to know its enigmatic pilot, Rei Ayanami, better. However, he is confounded because she is extremely insular, has no friends at all, and the entire record of her past has been erased. In the midst of this, a very powerful Angel, the floating monolith Ramiel, attacks Tokyo-3.

chapters.title: Rei (2)
chapters.description: Continuing from the previous episode, the Angel Ramiel is drilling down into the GeoFront to attack NERV HQ directly. After Shinji barely survived a direct confrontation with it, Misato devises a plan to have EVA-00 and EVA-01 defeat the Angel by sniping it from a distance using a positronic rifle which requires the total electric output of Japan to power up.

chapters.title: A Human Work
chapters.description: Ritsuko briefs Shinji on the real nature of Second Impact, the Angels, and the Evangelions' mission to defeat them. Misato and Ritsuko attend the public demonstration of a new Angel-fighting robot, Jet Alone, built by a rival defense contractor to NERV. However, the nuclear-powered robot quickly runs out of control, and Shinji must use EVA Unit 01 to load Misato onto Jet Alone so she can she can enter in its automatic shutdown code, before it melts down in a nuclear explosion.

chapters.title: Asuka Strikes!
chapters.description: Misato brings Shinji, along with Touji and Kensuke, to a massive UN naval convoy transporting Evangelion Unit-02 and its fiery German pilot, Asuka Langley Souryuu, to Japan. Escorting Asuka is Misato's old boyfriend, Ryouji Kaji. After some awkward introductions and reunions, the fleet is attacked by a massive aquatic Angel. Asuka powers up Eva-02, and decides that she will defeat the Angel by playing "hopscotch"...

chapters.title: Both of You, Dance Like You Want to Win!
chapters.description: Asuka joins Shinji’s class at school, and moves in with Misato and him in their apartment. As Asuka adjusts to Japan (or rather, everyone else adapts to her...), a new Angel attacks which is capable of splitting itself into two identical copies. EVA-01 and EVA-02 are defeated, and NERV is publicly humiliated. With the Angel in a week-long regeneration period after an N² Mine attack by the JSSDF, Asuka and Shinji must learn to "synchronize" with each others movements combat, in order to defeat it once and for all.

chapters.title: Magma Diver
chapters.description: The EVA pilots are disappointed to find out that they are not allowed to go on their class trip to Okinawa, because they have to stay at Tokyo-3 to stay on-call in case of an Angel attack. Meanwhile, a new Angel is discovered in a chrysalis-like developmental stage deep within the magma of the volcano Mount Asama.

chapters.title: The Day Tokyo-3 Stood Still
chapters.description: Tokyo-3 comes to a standstill when sabotage knocks out all power, and the personnel must scramble to launch the EVAs manually when an Angel appears in the middle of the blackout.

chapters.title: She said, 'Don't make others suffer for your personal hatred.'
chapters.description: Misato has been promoted to Major, but the celebration does not last long. A monstrous Angel appears in Earth orbit right when Gendo and Fuyutsuki are away, leaving her and the children to deal with a colossal kamikaze threatening to drop itself right on top of Tokyo-3.

chapters.title: Lilliputian Hitcher
chapters.description: A routine test involving the EVA pilots turns into a struggle for survival when a wholly new type of Angel appears and spreads inside NERV HQ. This new, computer-like angel threatens to set off the self-destruct for the entire facility, leaving Dr. Ritsuko Akagi in a race against time to save the GeoFront and destroy the Angel.

chapters.title: Weaving A Story (1)
chapters.description: In the first half of the episode, a clip show is presented to the Human Instrumentality Committee of Seele, reviewing the attacks of all Angels up to this point. The second part includes a poem in which Rei contemplates her own existence, and a cross-compatibility test between Rei's and Shinji's EVAs.

chapters.title: Those Women Longed for the Touch of Others' Lips, and Thus Invited Their Kisses.
chapters.description: It seems like it's an important day for nearly everyone at NERV. Misato and Ritsuko are going to a wedding; Shinji and Gendo are visiting Yui's grave; Asuka has a date. However, important things will spring from these seemingly mundane events.

chapters.title: Splitting of the Breast
chapters.description: Shinji beats Asuka in a synch test, much to her annoyance. Not too long after, the EVAs are dispatched to deal with a mysterious apparition, and EVA-01 is sucked into a shadowlike blackness that materializes out of nothingness from under it. While an emergency operation to rescue the captured EVA is concocted, Shinji goes on a trip into the depths of his own consciousness...

chapters.title: Fourth Children
chapters.description: A NERV branch in Nevada is obliterated in a catastrophic accident, and NERV headquarters prepares to station a new Evangelion in Japan. The Fourth Child is selected, unbeknownst to Shinji.

chapters.title: Ambivalence
chapters.description: Evangelion Unit-03 arrives from the United States. However, its activation experiment brings out NERV's worst nightmare when it turns out to have been infected by the Thirteenth Angel. The other EVAs are dispatched to battle the Angel-infected abomination... even at the risk of killing its helpless pilot.

chapters.title: Introjection
chapters.description: Enraged over Touji's near-death at the hands of his own EVA, Shinji refuses to pilot an Evangelion again and prepares to leave Tokyo-3 for good. He is forced to reconsider that decision when an immensely destructive new Angel attacks just as he is about to leave...

chapters.title: Weaving A Story (2): Oral Stage
chapters.description: Shinji achieved an unprecedented 400% synchronization ratio with EVA-01 during the battle with Zeruel, to horrible effect. With the EVA having ascended to the status of a living God and Shinji absorbed inside it, Ritsuko unsuccessfully attempts to recover him.

chapters.title: He Was Aware that He Was Still a Child.
chapters.description: Kouzou Fuyutsuki is kidnapped and interrogated by Seele, who are horrified over the results of the last encounter with an Angel. He recounts his past, providing flashbacks into the creation of Nerv. The pasts of Misato Katsuragi, Ritsuko Akagi, Rei Ayanami and Yui Ikari are also revealed. Ryouji Kaji, meanwhile, decides to find out the truth, no matter the cost.

chapters.title: Don't Be.
chapters.description: Asuka's synch rate is on a downward spiral after her defeat at the hands of the Fourteenth Angel, Zeruel, and her frustration with Rei, Shinji, Misato and Ryouji is on the rise. Angrier and more disturbed than ever, she is forced to relive her dark, traumatic past during the encounter with the Fifteenth Angel, Arael.

chapters.title: Rei (3)
chapters.description: Asuka sinks into deep depression after Arael's mental probing, and is unable to pilot when the new Angel Armisael arrives. Armisael begins physically fusing with EVA-00 and threatens to do the same to EVA-01, prompting Rei to sacrifice herself to save Shinji, only to appear alive soon afterwards.

chapters.title: The Beginning and the End, or 'Knockin' on Heaven's Door'
chapters.description: Too frightened to face Misato or Rei, Shinji runs away yet again, only to meet and strike a friendship with Kaworu Nagisa, the replacement pilot for EVA-02. Kaworu's openness and friendliness provide much-needed comfort for the disturbed Shinji. However, suspicions abound over Kaworu's incredible synchronization abilities.

chapters.title: Do You Love Me?
chapters.description: Instrumentality has begun, and now its inner process, the joining of all souls into one, will be depicted. The episode is primarily driven by dialogue, the background usually complete darkness. White text often appears on a black screen, an omniscient voice questioning the characters.

chapters.title: Take Care of Yourself.
chapters.description: Instrumentality continues. The focus is primarily on Shinji now, as he learns to accept the individual’s ability to shape their world, and how the self cannot exist without others to define it.

title: Generation War
description: Berlin, summer of 1941, during the World War II. Five young Germans promise to meet again as soon the war ends… in Christmas: brothers Wilhelm and Friedhelm will go to the Russian front. Charlotte will serve as a nurse in a campaign hospital. Greta dreams of becoming a singer. Viktor, her Jewish boyfriend, works as a tailor with her father. But soon their naive wishes of peace and happiness will become a long and tragic nightmare.

seasons.title: Miniseries
seasons.description: Berlin, summer of 1941, during the World War II. Five young Germans promise to meet again as soon the war ends… in Christmas: brothers Wilhelm and Friedhelm will go to the Russian front. Charlotte will serve as a nurse in a campaign hospital. Greta dreams of becoming a singer. Viktor, her Jewish boyfriend, works as a tailor with her father. But soon their naive wishes of peace and happiness will become a long and tragic nightmare.

chapters.title: A Different Time
chapters.description: 1941. Shortly before the German invasion of the Soviet Union, five close friends have a party in Berlin. The brothers Wilhelm and Friedhelm are respectively an officer and enlisted man in the military. Viktor is a Jew who works as a tailor. Charlotte has just passed her examination to become a military nurse. Greta is a beautiful bartender who wishes to become a famous singer. The friends are hopeful that they will meet again by Christmas. Wilhelm and Friedhelm witness some early victories as the German army heads toward Moscow. Charlotte gets used to seeing blood as she works near the front-line. Greta sleeps with a major in the Gestapo to advance her career as a singer, and to obtain documents for Viktor to flee to New York City, since the rights of Jews are being diminished. However, Viktor is arrested by the Gestapo and is put on a train.

chapters.title: A Different War
chapters.description: The invasion is being pushed back by the Russians, causing high casualties for the Germans. Wilhelm gets wounded and left for dead. When he wakes up, instead of going back to the base, he finds a cabin by a lake and lives on his own for a few weeks. He is discovered by the German Army and sentenced to death for desertion. Friedhelm is sent back home, but seeing his father's disappointment with Wilhelm's apparent death, and lack of appreciation for his survival, he enlists again. Viktor escapes the Germans and joins a group of Polish partisans, but tries to conceal his Jewish race because they hate Jews. Charlotte feels despair over Wilhelm's apparent death and starts an affair with a military doctor. Greta visits the front-line and becomes disillusioned by what she discovers there. She is arrested and thrown into prison for making remarks in public that disapprove of the war and the Nazi regime.

chapters.title: A Different Country
chapters.description: The Soviet army is pushing toward Berlin. Not just the war is doomed but Nazism's existence. Wilhelm's death sentence is lowered to probation. The probation officer abuses Wilhelm, who ultimately reacts by killing him and running. Viktor is expelled from the partisans for being a Jew. He crosses paths with Friedhelm, who kills his commanding officer, so Viktor can escape. After the German army falls apart, Friedhelm dies while leading a group of German militia, sacrificing himself to make his troops surrender. Charlotte is captured by the Soviets and becomes a nurse for them. Greta is executed by the Nazi authorities for her speech crimes. Finally, the war ends in 1945, and the three survivors, Wilhelm, Viktor, and Charlotte, meet in the same pub as before and grieve together.

title: The Amazing World of Gumball
description: The life of Gumball Watterson, a 12-year old cat who attends middle school in Elmore. Accompanied by his pet, adoptive brother, and best friend Darwin Watterson, he frequently finds himself involved in various shenanigans around the city, during which he interacts with various family members: Anais, Richard, and Nicole Watterson, and other various citizens.

seasons.title: Specials
