chapters.title: Early Reel
chapters.description: Gumball and Darwin build a Rube Goldberg machine in an attempt to escape from school

seasons.title: Season 1
seasons.description: The first season of the British-American animated comedy television series The Amazing World of Gumball originally aired from May 3, 2011 and March 13, 2012 on Cartoon Network. Consisting of 36 episodes, the season premiered with the episode "The DVD" and concluded with the episode "The Fight".

chapters.title: The DVD
chapters.description: An overdue DVD causes chaos (and a hefty fee) for Gumball and Darwin.

chapters.title: The Responsible
chapters.description: Gumball and Darwin get to babysit Anais whilst their parents go to a PTA meeting but being "responsible" has a different meaning when you don't know what it means.

chapters.title: The Third
chapters.description: Gumball and Darwin grow bored of one another and seek out a third friend to make their lives more exciting.

chapters.title: The Debt
chapters.description: Believing that his life had been saved, Gumball vows to repay his debt by saving Mr. Robinson's life.

chapters.title: The End
chapters.description: Gumball and Darwin, thinking that the world will end in 24 hours, decide to make the most out of their remaining time.

chapters.title: The Dress
chapters.description: When his clothes are shrunk in the washing machine by his father, Gumball is forced to wear his mother's wedding dress to school.

chapters.title: The Quest
chapters.description: Gumball and Darwin help Anais get her beloved doll back after it is lost on the way to school.

chapters.title: The Spoon
chapters.description: Gumball and Darwin become unwitting accomplices in a stick-up at a gas station.

chapters.title: The Pressure
chapters.description: When Masami claims that Darwin is her boyfriend, Gumball vows to help his friend before he gets kissed.

chapters.title: The Painting
chapters.description: After seeing a picture that Anais drew, Principal Brown assumes that Anais finds her family dysfunctional, so he begins to meddle in their family life.

chapters.title: The Laziest
chapters.description: Gumball and Darwin challenge their father to a laziness competition, with the loser having to do the winner's chores.

chapters.title: The Ghost
chapters.description: When a ghost named Carrie possesses Gumball's body in order to feel earthly experiences and to eat, he must learn to say "no" to her.

chapters.title: The Mystery
chapters.description: Gumball decides to investigate when his class finds Principal Brown wrapped up in toilet paper, shaved and, covered in green paint, or else face detention.

chapters.title: The Prank
chapters.description: Gumball and Darwin's pranks on their father get out of hand.

chapters.title: The Gi
chapters.description: Gumball and Darwin are ridiculed for their martial-arts outfits by their schoolmates, and their mom tries to convince them to take them off.

chapters.title: The Kiss
chapters.description: A kiss from Grandma JoJo traumatizes Gumball, and Darwin attempts to help him forget.

chapters.title: The Party
chapters.description: Gumball and his friends are invited to a high-school party hosted by Tobias's sister Rachel, but they must find dates in order to attend.

chapters.title: The Refund
chapters.description: Gumball and Darwin go to great lengths to get their money back from an incompatible video game, but the rental store's policy prevents them from getting it.

chapters.title: The Robot
chapters.description: Gumball decides to help Bobert act like a real boy. However, it soon becomes a battle for his very identity when the robot plots to take over his life.

chapters.title: The Picnic
chapters.description: A school picnic in the Forest of Doom poses a hazard for Gumball and Darwin.

chapters.title: The Goons
chapters.description: Gumball competes in a race in order to win Dad back.

chapters.title: The Secret
chapters.description: Gumball tries desperately to find out Darwin's secret.

chapters.title: The Sock
chapters.description: Mr. Small teaches Gumball and Darwin various ways of becoming more honest.

chapters.title: The Genius
chapters.description: Darwin goes to an institute for geniuses.

chapters.title: The Poltergeist
chapters.description: Richard believes there's a ghost in the attic but is actually Mr. Robinson who Gumball moved up there after entering a catatonic state due to being kicked out by his wife. Gumball and Darwin work on trying to restore Mr. Robinson whilst Richard, unaware of this, sets traps for the ghost.

chapters.title: The Mustache
chapters.description: Gumball and Darwin want to become adults, Richard wants to lose weight. After accidentally having their cereal switched with supplements Richard ordered, Gumball, Darwin and Anais find themselves having very unusual growth spurts.

chapters.title: The Date
chapters.description: Gumball learns how to date so he can go out on a date with Penny. Later on it turns out that he is going to a funeral not a date.

chapters.title: The Club
chapters.description: When Gumball turns down an offer to join the Rejects Club, they seek to enact revenge against him.

chapters.title: The Wand
chapters.description: The guys share the power of magic with Dad.

chapters.title: The Ape
chapters.description: Ms. Simian cozies up to Gumball in order to win an award

chapters.title: The Car
chapters.description: Gumball and Darwin are eager enough to do numerous chores at Mr. Robinson's house, until they accidentally destroy his car.

chapters.title: The Curse
chapters.description: Gumball's good day turns bad to worse throughout his school day, much to the point where he believes he is "cursed".

chapters.title: The Microwave
chapters.description: Gumball creates a creature, made of every gross thing he could find, with a cannibalistic appetite.

chapters.title: The Meddler
chapters.description: Seeing Gumball in need of attention, Nicole hangs out with him at school, which becomes increasingly embarrassing for her son.

chapters.title: The Helmet
chapters.description: Gumball wears a lucky helmet, but it tears his family apart.

chapters.title: The Fight
chapters.description: After Gumball's bullying problem, Tina Rex demands to have a fight with him.

seasons.title: Season 2
seasons.description: The second season of the British-American animated comedy series The Amazing World of Gumball originally aired from August 7, 2012 to December 3, 2013. Consisting of 40 episodes, the season premiered with the episode "The Remote" and concluded with the episode "The Finale."

chapters.title: The Remote
chapters.description: The Watterson family fights over the remote when they realize everything they want to watch comes on at the same time.

chapters.title: The Colossus
chapters.description: Gumball and Darwin upset a giant.

chapters.title: The Knights
chapters.description: Gumball and Tobias compete for Penny's affection by putting on the lamest duel in history.

chapters.title: The Fridge
chapters.description: Mom tries to inspire Gumball to develop ambition.

chapters.title: The Flower
chapters.description: Gumball is jealous when he sees Leslie with Penny.

chapters.title: The Banana
chapters.description: Gumball seeks justice when Banana Joe chews Darwin's pen.

chapters.title: The Phone
chapters.description: Darwin develops a texting addiction when he and Gumball get their first cell phone.

chapters.title: The Job
chapters.description: Richard gets a job as a pizza delivery man, which worries Nicole when strange things begin to occur around the neighborhood.

chapters.title: Halloween
chapters.description: Gumball, Darwin and Anais go to a haunted-house party.

chapters.title: The Treasure
chapters.description: Anais hunts for hidden treasure after uncovering a secret.

chapters.title: The Apology
chapters.description: Ms. Simian owes Gumball an apology.

chapters.title: The Words
chapters.description: Darwin tries to be more direct with Gumball as his teacher.

chapters.title: The Skull
chapters.description: The guys befriend a compulsive liar.

chapters.title: The Bet
chapters.description: Bobert becomes Gumball's servant and obeys every command he receives.

chapters.title: Christmas
chapters.description: Santa Claus is coming to town. Unfortunately he gets run over by the Wattersons, so it's up to them to save Christmas.

chapters.title: The Watch
chapters.description: The guys try to retrieve a family heirloom from an old man.

chapters.title: The Bumpkin
chapters.description: Gumball envies rural life and asks Idaho to teach his family to live like potatoes.

chapters.title: The Flakers
chapters.description: Darwin abandons Gumball when faced with a beating by Tina, so Gumball plots revenge.

chapters.title: The Authority
chapters.description: After Richard is hospitalized from an accident, Granny JoJo is overprotective and puts the family in danger, which leads Nicole to disagree with her parenting style.

chapters.title: The Virus
chapters.description: An evil virus seeks vengeance on Gumball, Darwin, and Teri after they wipe out his army of bacteria.

chapters.title: The Pony
chapters.description: Gumball and Darwin rent a film to watch with Anais, but they keep getting distracted on their way home.

chapters.title: The Hero
chapters.description: Richard gets upset when he realizes Gumball and Darwin think of him as a laughing stock.

chapters.title: The Dream
chapters.description: Darwin kisses Penny in one of Gumball's dreams and he gets mad about it.

chapters.title: The Sidekick
chapters.description: Gumball and Darwin try to get a game back from Tobias, but Darwin begins to feel like he is just a sidekick to Gumball.

chapters.title: The Photo
chapters.description: Gumball tries to look good in the school photos.

chapters.title: The Tag
chapters.description: Gumball and Darwin get caught in the middle of a trash can feud between Richard and Mr. Robinson.

chapters.title: The Storm
chapters.description: A plot to improve Alan and Carmen's relationship backfires, and Gumball has to reunite them.

chapters.title: The Lesson
chapters.description: The guys have detention and try to escape; Granny JoJo is overprotective and puts the family in danger.

chapters.title: The Game
chapters.description: The Wattersons play Dodge or Dare.

chapters.title: The Limit
chapters.description: Mom lets the Wattersons have it in a supermarket.

chapters.title: The Voice
chapters.description: When Gumball and Darwin receive a scary email, everyone is a suspect...

chapters.title: The Promise
chapters.description: Darwin has promised to play video games with Gumball, but there is a Banana Joe-shaped problem...

chapters.title: The Castle
chapters.description: When Nicole is away "anything goes" and Richard's lack of rules soon attracts unwelcome house guests.

chapters.title: The Sweaters
chapters.description: Gumball and Darwin's reputation is challenged and they really couldn't care less...

chapters.title: The Internet
chapters.description: Gumball decides to take down the Internet after he accidentally creates an embarrasing viral web video.

chapters.title: The Plan
chapters.description: The Watterson kids come up with a fool-proof plan to save Nicole, but is it Gumball-proof?

chapters.title: The World
chapters.description: The life of the "inanimate" objects of Elmore are shown in a series of short skits.

chapters.title: The Finale
chapters.description: The Wattersons are surprised to discover that their past actions have consequences.

seasons.title: Season 3
seasons.description: The third season of the British-American animated comedy series The Amazing World of Gumball premiered on June 5, 2014 in the United States and September 14, 2014 in the United Kingdom. The season will consist of 40 episodes and debuted with the episode "The Kids."

chapters.title: The Kids
chapters.description: Gumball and Darwin's voices start to break.

chapters.title: The Fan
chapters.description: New Elmore Junior High student Sarah becomes Gumball and Darwin's obsessive number-one fan.

chapters.title: The Coach
chapters.description: The new coach at Elmore Junior High stands up to Jamie.

chapters.title: The Joy
chapters.description: Miss Simian has to save herself from a contagious Joy virus infecting Elmore Junior High.

chapters.title: The Puppy
chapters.description: The Watterson children's long-awaited pet puppy turns out to be a turtle which hates them.

chapters.title: The Recipe
chapters.description: Gumball and Darwin discover the secret behind their classmate Anton's immortality.

chapters.title: The Name
chapters.description: Gumball learns his real name.

chapters.title: The Extras
chapters.description: Skits about the random extra characters seen throughout the series.

chapters.title: The Gripes
chapters.description: When Gumball and Darwin begin to complain about every little thing in their lives, the people of Elmore City mistakenly assumes charity cases and put together a benefit to raise money for them, leaving them having to fix the mix-up.

chapters.title: The Vacation
chapters.description: While driving to a campground, Michelle tells a horror story, which slowly starts to come true as their car breaks down and a stranger comes to help them out.

chapters.title: The Fraud
chapters.description: Gumball and Darwin discover Principal Brown's diploma is a fake.

chapters.title: The Void
chapters.description: When Gumball and Darwin investigate a missing classmate, they discover a far greater mystery....about Elmore.

chapters.title: The Boss
chapters.description: Mr. Robertson has a stress attack and needs a  stuffing transfusion from his son Rocky the janitor. He won't take it unless Rocky gets a better job in life. Rocky gets one with Chanax, where he becomes a work drone. Gumball and Darwin now need to get Rocky's soul back from his boss in order to get him to surgery.

chapters.title: The Move
chapters.description: Clayton may be a liar, but Gumball discovers he wasn't lying about his awesome martial arts move.

chapters.title: The Law
chapters.description: The Doughnut Sheriff shows Gumball and Darwin that the smallest misdemeanor can lead to a breakdown in law.

chapters.title: The Allergy
chapters.description: Gumball needs to find a cure for Darwin's allergy before he sneezes Elmore off the map.

chapters.title: The Mothers
chapters.description: It's Mother's Day and kids put their moms through a series of tests to determine who has the World's Greatest Mom.

chapters.title: The Password
chapters.description: Gumball and Darwin are shocked to discover that Anais is Dad's favorite child.

chapters.title: The Procrastinators
chapters.description: Gumball and Darwin spend the day doing other things instead of taking out the trash like their mother told them to do before she got back home.

chapters.title: The Shell
chapters.description: Gumball inadvertently cracks open Penny's shell, and discovers who she really is inside...

chapters.title: The Burden
chapters.description: Gumball and Darwin are left in charge of the class pet hamster, but they end up leaving it at school over the weekend.

chapters.title: The Bros
chapters.description: Darwin becomes jealous of Gumball and Penny's new relationship and sets out to find information that will break them up.

chapters.title: The Mirror
chapters.description: Gumball refuses to forward an e-mail purportedly sent by a ghost, against Darwin's advice. When a curse begins to take effect and their family is dragged into another dimension, Gumball and Darwin seek Carrie's help to save them.

chapters.title: The Man
chapters.description: After Granny Jojo brings her new boyfriend to dinner at the Watterson household, Richard forbids her from seeing the boyfriend again.

chapters.title: The Pizza
chapters.description: The Wattersons have had a bad day, but it turns out Larry has too and it's about to get worse . . . for everyone!

chapters.title: The Lie
chapters.description: Noticing that everyone is in the doldrums of January, Gumball and Anais invent a new holiday to spark excitement.

chapters.title: The Butterfly
chapters.description: Gumball and Darwin let loose a butterfly from a jar, causing all sorts of chaos throughout the town.

chapters.title: The Question
chapters.description: Gumball and Darwin try to figure out the meaning of life after coming down from a sugar rush.

chapters.title: The Saint
chapters.description: After failing at making Alan lose his temper, Gumball and Darwin decide to adopt Alan's positive attitude.

chapters.title: The Friend
chapters.description: Gumball and Darwin help Anais make up an imaginary friend who turns out to be all too real.

chapters.title: The Oracle
chapters.description: After discovering a prophetic painting depicting Gumball's naked run through the mall, he is determined to avoid that outcome.

chapters.title: The Safety
chapters.description: Darwin becomes obsessed with safety after seeing a video in class.

chapters.title: The Society
chapters.description: When Gumball learns the school has a secret society, he is determined, and irritating, to become a part of it.

chapters.title: The Spoiler
chapters.description: When Gumball and Darwin have to wait to see a movie, they must go an entire week without someone spoiling the plot.

chapters.title: The Countdown
chapters.description: Miss Simian threatens to expel the boys if they are late for school, so they race a clock in order to arrive on time.

chapters.title: The Nobody
chapters.description: Gumball and Darwin investigate the disappearance  of the family's stuff only to find out some stranger is living in the house with them.

chapters.title: The Downer
chapters.description: When Gumball's family tries to cheer him out of an inexplicable lousy mood, he wishes they would all disappear

chapters.title: The Egg
chapters.description: Anais has a play date with a classy family

chapters.title: The Triangle
chapters.description: Gumball grows jealous of Darwin's new talent.

chapters.title: The Money
chapters.description: The Wattersons become poor when Richard loses all their money.

seasons.title: Season 4
seasons.description: The fourth season of the British-American animated comedy series The Amazing World of Gumball premiered on July 7, 2015 in the United States with the episode "The Return." It will consist of 40 eleven-minute episodes, as were the previous two seasons.

chapters.title: The Return
chapters.description: Richard tries to find the kids before Nicole realizes they're gone.

chapters.title: The Nemesis
chapters.description: Gumball and Darwin discover that Rob, who once swore to wreak vengeance on them, has been trying to destroy them for some time… but his traps never work.

chapters.title: The Crew
chapters.description: When Gumball and Darwin decide to join a crew, they are determined to prove their worth to senior citizens.

chapters.title: The Others
chapters.description: After learning what grade Anais is in, Gumball and Darwin learn that there is a whole new world of students.

chapters.title: The Signature
chapters.description: When Richard learns of Granny Jojo's plans to marry, he sets out to adopt Louie so he can forbid the wedding.

chapters.title: The Check
chapters.description: Gumball, Darwin and Anais are delighted when Grandpa Louie gives them a check for $5000, but the family soon fights over how to spend it.

chapters.title: The Pest
chapters.description: When they find Anais training herself for a brutal showdown, Gumball and Darwin realise that their sister is being pestered at school by an annoying kid: Billy. They try to teach her how to resolve the problem peacefully, but Billy has other ideas.

chapters.title: The Sale
chapters.description: Gumball and Darwin are crushed to learn that Mr. Robinson is selling his house and moving away, and when trying to make their final moments together last doesn't work, the duo decide to sabotage the sale.

chapters.title: The Gift
chapters.description: After they receive an extravagant invitation to Masami's birthday party, Gumball and Darwin are anxious to find just the right gift for her. However, they're not the only ones: it turns out every kid in Elmore is competing to get Masami the perfect present.

chapters.title: The Parking
chapters.description: When the Wattersons arrive at the mall for a day of shopping, they struggle to find a space in the parking lot. They search for a space everywhere -- using all their intelligence, cunning and trickery -- but as the day goes on, the desperate hunt for a space becomes more important than the trip to the mall itself.

chapters.title: The Routine
chapters.description: Richard's trip to the store to find mayonnaise for the family's burger night turns into a Neverending Story-meets-Conan the Barbarian-style quest where he squares off against Tina Rex's father, Mr. Rex.

chapters.title: The Upgrade
chapters.description: Gumball and Darwin upgrade Bobert the robot – and discover that his new operating system is full of buggy and useless applications and is prone to crashing.

chapters.title: The Comic
chapters.description: Sarah G. Lato (the gelato cone girl from "The Sweaters" and "The Fan" who obsessively draws fan art of Gumball and Darwin) creates a comic of Gumball as a superhero named LaserHeart, prompting Gumball to act like one in real life.

chapters.title: The Romantic
chapters.description: Fearing that she may be sick of him due to a missing emoji on her message to him, Gumball sends Penny on a romantic quest to rekindle their love, which turns into a disaster when Penny gets lost in the woods.

chapters.title: The Uploads
chapters.description: Gumball and Darwin get hooked on watching Elmore Stream (the show's version of YouTube) and viewers get a look at the different online videos the residents of Elmore have uploaded on the Internet.

chapters.title: The Apprentice
chapters.description: Gumball tags along with Patrick Fitzgerald (Penny's father) as Patrick prepares to pitch plans for a new hospital to the CEO of Chanax -- and ends up roping him into a golf game with the CEO.

chapters.title: The Hug
chapters.description: To prove to Darwin that he can be unpredictable, Gumball decides to hug the first person he sees -- an anthropomorphic hot dog -- and Gumball ends up in over his head when he and the Hot Dog Guy can't stop bumping into each other.

chapters.title: The Wicked
chapters.description: After being framed for feeding coffee- and prune juice-laced nuts to the squirrels, Darwin tries to prove to Gumball that Mr. Robinson's wife, Margaret, is a good person underneath her destructive, sociopathic tendencies, but when Darwin sees just how evil Margaret is, the duo decide to catch her committing grand theft auto.

chapters.title: The Traitor
chapters.description: When Alan allegedly ditches Gumball's dinner date with him, Gumball is desperate to track him down and make him pay for his betrayal, only to learn that Alan is taking his mother, Jessica, to the hospital for an organ transplant.

chapters.title: The Origins (1)
chapters.description: In this, the first half-hour episode, a four-year-old Gumball becomes too much for young parents, Nicole and Richard, to handle, so they buy him a goldfish, but after the first six die from neglect, stupidity, and unfortunate incidents, Richard finds a special one in a shady red van who bonds with Gumball on a spiritual level. This gets put to the test when Darwin gets flushed down the toilet and must traverse a scary, new world to return home.

chapters.title: The Origins (2)
chapters.description: In this, the first half-hour episode, a four-year-old Gumball becomes too much for young parents, Nicole and Richard, to handle, so they buy him a goldfish, but after the first six die from neglect, stupidity, and unfortunate incidents, Richard finds a special one in a shady red van who bonds with Gumball on a spiritual level. This gets put to the test when Darwin gets flushed down the toilet and must traverse a scary, new world to return home.

chapters.title: The Girlfriend
chapters.description: After seeing Alan and Carmen bond during her lunchtime bullying, Jamie decides that she needs a sweetheart...and has her eyes on Darwin.

chapters.title: The Advice
chapters.description: Mr. Small feels that he hasn't inspired the children of Elmore Junior High, so Gumball and Darwin try to lift his spirits...and end up causing chaos and putting most of the students (and faculty) in the school infirmary (and others in the hospital) after following Mr. Small's useless advice.

chapters.title: The Signal
chapters.description: Gumball develops a strange stutter, and it makes him accidentally offend Darwin.

chapters.title: The Parasite
chapters.description: Gumball and Darwin read Anais' diary and discover her relationship with a new friend is one-sided.

chapters.title: The Love
chapters.description: The people of Elmore search for the meaning of love.

chapters.title: The Awkwardness
chapters.description: Gumball is walking in the same direction as Hot Dog Guy, and with each step it becomes increasingly awkward.

chapters.title: The Nest
chapters.description: A neighbor disappears and the Wattersons investigate, but discover the culprit may be their Evil Turtle.

chapters.title: The Points
chapters.description: In order for Tobias to let them use his points in a video game, Gumball and Darwin must do his chores for him.

chapters.title: The Bus
chapters.description: Rocky convinces the kids that they do not have to go to school. However, unbeknownst to the kids, some adults are trying to teach them about skipping school.

chapters.title: The Night
chapters.description: The Moon examines dreams and nightmares of Elmore residents.

chapters.title: The Misunderstandings
chapters.description: On his way to a date with Penny, Gumball finds himself dealing with people at their most oblivious.

chapters.title: The Roots
chapters.description: The family tries to make Darwin connect with his fish roots.

chapters.title: The Blame
chapters.description: After Felicity bans video games in Elmore, Gumball and his friends try to have books banned instead.

chapters.title: The Slap
chapters.description: Tobias offends Gumball when he doesn't slap him on the butt.

chapters.title: The Detective
chapters.description: When Daisy goes missing, Anais suspects Gumball and Darwin.

chapters.title: The Fury
chapters.description: A strange figure arrives and insults Nicole, but the kids are surprised when Nicole doesn't fight back.

chapters.title: The Compilation
chapters.description: Odd internet clips are recalled by the people of Elmore.

chapters.title: The Scam
chapters.description: Carrie backs up Gumball's story about a monster, and the students want to hire them as ghost exterminators for Halloween candy

chapters.title: The Disaster
chapters.description: Rob gets new powers through a remote control and tries to destroy Gumball's world.

seasons.title: Season 5

chapters.title: The Rerun
chapters.description: In this sequel to last season's "The Disaster", Gumball travels back to the events of the previous episode to prevent Rob from ruining his life, but everything he does makes things worse.

chapters.title: The Stories
chapters.description: Molly gets coaching from the guys to improve her story-telling.

chapters.title: The Guy
chapters.description: Gumball and Darwin are wary of Anais' new friend, Josh, making her question his motives as well.

chapters.title: The Boredom
chapters.description: Gumball and Darwin search for adventure during a walk around Elmore.

chapters.title: The Vision
chapters.description: After finding a secret manifesto on Alan's memory stick, Gumball and Darwin decide to foil his plan for world domination.

chapters.title: The Choices
chapters.description: Nicole reminisces about how she met Richard during a disastrous family dinner, and how things could have turned out for her if she had not.

chapters.title: The Code
chapters.description: The family goes without wi-fi after Mr. Robinson changes the passcode, so Gumball tries to recover it.

chapters.title: The Test
chapters.description: When he is labeled a "loser" in an online test, Gumball believes he must do the opposite of everything he would normally do. Meanwhile, Darwin and Sarah notice Tobias is stealing Gumball's life and role in the series in the form of a cheesy sitcom.

chapters.title: The Slide
chapters.description: Rocky decides to stop living life online, and find love on a dating app, and Gumball and Darwin try to help him.

chapters.title: The Loophole
chapters.description: Gumball and Darwin give Bobert instructions so he will behave in a safe and responsible manner, but he applies his logic to their rules.

chapters.title: The Fuss
chapters.description: Nicole tries, and fails, to hide her disappointment when Richard and the kids fail to remember her special day. Richard has to figure out what special day he has actually forgotten and then make it a day to remember or else.

chapters.title: The Copycats
chapters.description: Gumball and Darwin are confused when they meet Chi Chi and Ribbit, a pair of siblings that copy everything they do and say. Then they find out this copycat family is making money online from imitating the Watterson family.

chapters.title: The Potato
chapters.description: When Darwin has lunch with Idaho, he decides to stop eating potatoes in solidarity with his brotato, but he finds his obsession with his favorite food harder to kick than he ever imagined, so Gumball decides to help his friend curb his carb cravings.

chapters.title: The Outside
chapters.description: The family goes to visit Richard's dad. Based on his basic living standards and extended absence from Richard's life, they assume Frankie must have done a stretch in the slammer.

chapters.title: The Vase
chapters.description: Sick of Granny Jojo's ugly gifts, Nicole encourages the kids to take matters into their own hands and "accidentally" break her latest hideous vase. But when Gumball, Darwin, and Anais try to destroy it, they discover it is more robust than it seems.

chapters.title: The Matchmaker
chapters.description: Gumball enlists Carrie to help bring Darwin and Teri together, but when they can't make Darwin and Teri's love blossom naturally, they decide to make it happen supernaturally.

chapters.title: The Box
chapters.description: The Wattersons receive an unmarked package in the mail. To distract themselves from the urge to open it they all take turns to imagine what it might contain.

chapters.title: The Console
chapters.description: When Gumball is given a cursed video game console, Elmore becomes trapped inside a fantasy RPG world. Gumball, Darwin and Anais have to battle their way through town, unraveling the secrets of their new virtual reality.

chapters.title: The Ollie
chapters.description: Gumball teaches Darwin everything he knows about the world of skateboarding.

chapters.title: The Catfish
chapters.description: When Gumball and Darwin realize Grandpa Louie has no friends, they create one called Muriel, when Granny Jojo finds out Louie has been spending time online with another woman, Muriel not existing is not going to stop her from being destroyed.

chapters.title: The Cycle
chapters.description: Gumball, Darwin and Anais discover that Mr. Wilson has been picking on Richard for most of his life; ever since he humiliated Richard with a high school prank. The kids try to work their dad through it, but when their efforts fail they realize that getting back at Mr. Wilson is the only way to break the cycle.

chapters.title: The Stars
chapters.description: When Richard gives Larry’s hairdresser a bad review for saying he’s bald, he gets offered a free haircut. This inspires Gumball and Darwin to go on a reviewing spree across town, forcing Larry to give them stuff with the threat of a bad review. But, just because the customer is always right doesn’t mean that what they’re doing isn’t wrong.

chapters.title: The Grades
chapters.description: When a failed test grade brings down Gumball’s grade point average, he is forced to return to kindergarten.

chapters.title: The Diet
chapters.description: Gumball and Darwin find out why Richard's diet wasn't working, and after they help him lose weight, he becomes more obnoxious.

chapters.title: The Ex
chapters.description: When Gumball learns that his nemesis, Rob, has found a new nemesis, he tries to sabotage Rob's new "enemy-ship," much to the frustration of Penny.

chapters.title: The Sorcerer
chapters.description: Gumball refuses to accept he is the only kid at school that does not have special powers. He convinces Mrs. Jötunheim, Hector's mom, to take him on as her apprentice but she soon learns leaving Gumball unsupervised around magic is a big mistake.

chapters.title: The Menu
chapters.description: The prize jewel on the Secret Joyful Burger menu is a mysterious burger, but to order it you need to know its name. When Larry refuses to tell Richard, Gumball, and Darwin what it is called, they go to super-sized lengths to discover it.

chapters.title: The Uncle
chapters.description: When Gumball finds out that Ocho has an uncle named Mario, he becomes desperate to meet him.

chapters.title: The Weirdo
chapters.description: When they see the school bullies making fun of Sussie, Gumball and Darwin decide to try and help her act less weird. They carefully observe her behavior and decide that the only thing they have to change is absolutely everything.

chapters.title: The Heist
chapters.description: Richard discovers that going into a bank whilst wearing a motorcycle helmet can lead to trouble.

chapters.title: The Singing
chapters.description: Join the citizens of Elmore for a song and dance spectacular that will have people covering their ears with joy.

chapters.title: The Best
chapters.description: No matter what Gumball does, Carmen thinks she knows better; when Gumball attempts to gain the moral high ground, but fails, his only option left is to bring Carmen down to his level.

chapters.title: The Worst
chapters.description: The Wattersons compete over who has the worst life.

chapters.title: The Deal
chapters.description: Richard goes on strike to prove that his work around the house is under appreciated by Nicole.

chapters.title: The Petals
chapters.description: When Leslie's petals begin falling off, he feels like his good looks are fading, so Gumball and Darwin use everything they know about style and beauty to try and help him.

chapters.title: The Nuisance
chapters.description: The Wattersons fear the worst when they are summoned to a Town Hall meeting, but are surprised when they're offered a new house - until they discover it's in a different state.

chapters.title: The Line
chapters.description: The Wattersons will do whatever it takes to get into the first screening of the latest Stellar Odyssey sequel.

chapters.title: The List
chapters.description: When the kids find out that Mom's life hasn't panned out as she'd hoped, they start taking on her chores, but they accidentally grab her bucket list instead of her to-do list.

chapters.title: The News
chapters.description: From police chases to the inside scoop on Daisy the Donkey, Channel 6 Elmore News has all the top local stories. Experienced newscaster Kip Schlezinger brings the latest news, sports and weather, even when there is absolutely nothing to report.

chapters.title: The Puppets
chapters.description: Darwin is delighted when they discover their old childhood toys, but soon realizes that some things are best left in the past.

seasons.title: Season 6
seasons.description: The sixth season was confirmed on June 22, 2016 on Ben Bocquelet's Twitter. Unlike the first five seasons will have 44 episodes. The premiere date of this season was January 5, 2018.

chapters.title: The Rival
chapters.description: When Anais is a newborn baby, Gumball and Darwin become jealous of their new sibling, and spark a baby war.

chapters.title: The Lady
chapters.description: Gumball and Darwin find out that Dad has been dressing as a woman to make friends.

chapters.title: The Sucker
chapters.description: Darwin ends up in detention with Julius, who decides to make Darwin his new target. However, it backfires when Darwin ruins his life.

chapters.title: The Vegging
chapters.description: Gumball and Darwin want to veg out all day, but their plans go awry and they have to save the rest of the family.

chapters.title: The One
chapters.description: Tobias tries to be Gumball’s best friend.

chapters.title: The Father
chapters.description: The kids try to help Richard bond with Frankie.

chapters.title: The Cringe
chapters.description: Gumball and Hot Dog Guy discover why they're so awkward with each other

chapters.title: The Cage
chapters.description: The kids convince Mr. Corneille to become a cage fighter and set up a fight against a fearsome Russian fighter.

chapters.title: The Neighbor
chapters.description: Gumball and Darwin try to find out the name of their neighbor, Antlers Guy, but accidentally blow his witness protection cover.

chapters.title: The Anybody
chapters.description: When Clayton shapeshifts into Gumball to take his detention, he starts framing others for misdemeanors so Gumball and Darwin must track Clayton down to stop him.

chapters.title: The Faith
chapters.description: Alan has lost faith in humanity and turns the world black and white. Gumball must get over his hatred of Alan to bring the color back by singing.

chapters.title: The Candidate
chapters.description: A group of kids get locked in the school after their parents have a charity gala. They appoint Gumball as leader to get them out but it leads to chaos.

chapters.title: The Pact
chapters.description: Gumball and Principal Brown make a pact to tell each other what problems their girlfriends have.

chapters.title: The Shippening
chapters.description: Sarah finds a notebook from the Awesome Store which magically makes what she draws happen. Unfortunately, she draws bizarre love stories throughout Elmore.

chapters.title: The Brain
chapters.description: The Wattersons have to stop doing stupid things in order to prevent Anais from falling into a coma from facepalming too much.

chapters.title: The Parents
chapters.description: Nicole reconciles with her parents.

chapters.title: The Founder
chapters.description: Richard creates chaos in the Chanax building when he is mistaken for the long lost CEO. Nicole and a disgruntled employee must save everyone from Richard's dangerous ideas.

chapters.title: The Schooling
chapters.description: Gumball and Darwin take on Larry's jobs for 5 minutes and realize how bad it is.

chapters.title: The Intelligence
chapters.description: Technology reaches human intelligence then becomes dysfunctional as it picks up human flaws.

chapters.title: The Potion
chapters.description: Gumball and Darwin use a magic potion to shrink Hector.

chapters.title: The Spinoffs
chapters.description: Rob creates a variety of spinoff Elmore shows and formats to replace Gumball.

chapters.title: The Transformation
chapters.description: Gumball is asked to settle a dispute between Penny and her family.

chapters.title: The Understanding
chapters.description: Gumball and Darwin get into trouble misunderstanding a new kid in school.

chapters.title: The Ad
chapters.description: The Wattersons are forced to rent their house to a pair of elderly fainting goats.

chapters.title: The Ghouls
chapters.description: Halloween isn't what it used to be. Can Gumball and Darwin help the ghouls get their scare back?

chapters.title: The Stink
chapters.description: Mr. Small goes feral after Gumball and Darwin expose his hypocrisy.

chapters.title: The Awareness
chapters.description: Gumball decides to engross himself in plant culture to appease Leslie after making an offensive comment.

chapters.title: The Slip
chapters.description: Richard misses a package and is forced into an escalating feud with the delivery guy.

chapters.title: The Drama
chapters.description: Gumball tries to protect Darwin from his unsuitable undead girlfriend Carrie.

chapters.title: The Buddy
chapters.description: Anais and Jamie form an unlikely partnership when they're accused of a crime they didn't commit.

chapters.title: The Possession
chapters.description: Richard Watterson becomes supernaturally attached to his old refrigerator.

chapters.title: The Master
chapters.description: The Wattersons play a fantasy role-playing board game to resolve their differences.

chapters.title: The Silence
chapters.description: Gumball and Darwin finally run out of things to say to each other.

chapters.title: The Future
chapters.description: Banana Joe's Mom can predict the future, but she can't predict her own disappearance.

chapters.title: The Wish
chapters.description: Gumball and Darwin believe they've turned Miss Simian into a neck-cushion.

chapters.title: The Factory
chapters.description: Gumball and Darwin save the day at the Rainbow Factory.

chapters.title: The Agent
chapters.description: Gumball and Darwin's clothes go missing after a swimming lesson; when Gumball is forced to wear a tuxedo from the lost and found office, he believes it makes him look like a certain dapper British secret agent.

chapters.title: The Web
chapters.description: Gumball and Darwin realize that the adult residents of Elmore are dangerously naive when it comes to being safe online, and in fact are in serious need of the boys' help with even the simplest of tasks.

chapters.title: The Mess
chapters.description: After staying up all night, the boys baby-sit Penny's little sister and manage to lose her in the blink of an eye.

chapters.title: The Heart
chapters.description: Mr. Robinson tries and repeatedly fails to win back Gumball and Darwin's friendship.

chapters.title: The Revolt
chapters.description: Darwin tries to highlight the plight of all the household objects he feels are being oppressed and maltreated by the uncaring residents of Elmore, then decides to lead those objects in a revolt against the townspeople.

chapters.title: The Decisions
chapters.description: When everything goes wrong in Darwin's life, he begins to suspect that Gumball's bad influence might be to blame; Darwin decides to go elsewhere for guidance and finds a new mentor in Alan.

chapters.title: The BFFs
chapters.description: When Gumball's old BFF Fuzzy turns up on his doorstep, Darwin struggles to accept that there was someone before him and fails to contain his jealousy.

chapters.title: The Inquisition
chapters.description: The students of Elmore Junior High find their world turned upside down when the mysterious school superintendent comes to stamp out their cartoonish ways.

title: Fawlty Towers
description:
Fawlty Towers is a British sitcom produced by BBC Television that was first broadcast on BBC2 in 1975 and 1979. Twelve episodes were made. The show was written by John Cleese and his then wife Connie Booth, both of whom also starred in the show.

The series is set in Fawlty Towers, a fictional hotel in the seaside town of Torquay, on the "English Riviera". The plots centre around tense, rude and put-upon owner Basil Fawlty, his bossy wife Sybil, a comparatively normal chambermaid Polly, and hapless Spanish waiter Manuel and their attempts to run the hotel amidst farcical situations and an array of demanding and eccentric guests.

In a list drawn up by the British Film Institute in 2000, voted by industry professionals, Fawlty Towers was named the best British television series of all time.

chapters.title: John Cleese Interview (1)
chapters.description: An interview with the man himself, as he tells all about the making of each of the episodes of Fawlty Towers and the writing process behind them as well as the good and bad moments from behind the scenes.

chapters.title: Andrew Sachs Interview
chapters.description: An interview with the legendary actor Andrew Sachs, in which he tells us about his time on the show and of how the much loved character of Manuel was created.

chapters.title: A Visit to Torquay: Home of Fawlty Towers
Re-Opened
chapters.description:
To help celebrate its 30th anniversary, G.O.L.D. is throwing open the doors of TV's most famous hotel once more after a lengthy absence.

New and exclusive, Fawlty Towers: Re-opened gathers cast and crew together to retrace the history of the sitcom from a rarely seen insider point of view. The one-off special leaves no English Riviera stone unturned in its search for trivia and nuggets of information from the Fawlty Towers guestbook, together with in-depth interviews with John Cleese, Andrew Sachs and Prunella Scales, as well as Connie Booth talking about her memories from the show for the first time in 30 years. Just don't mention the war.

chapters.title: Basil's Best Bits
chapters.description: Now here's an interesting way to celebrate the 30th birthday of a classic sitcom. For the first time ever, John Cleese reveals his favourite scenes from Fawlty Towers. No clues yet as to which ones they will be but there's the added bonus of the likes of Michael Palin, Terry Jones, Mitchell and Webb, Eddie Izzard and AA Gill reminiscing about these magic moments. Possibly even more interesting will be the comments from the owners of Gleanagles Hotel, which was the real-life inspiration for Fawlty Towers.

chapters.title: Fawlty Towers Re-Opened
chapters.description: Tiger Aspect Productions produced this 30th anniversary documentary for digital comedy channel G.O.L.D. The documentary features interviews with all four main cast members, including Connie Booth, who had, until now, refused to talk about the series.

chapters.title: Cheap Tatty Review
chapters.description: The Cheap Tatty Review is an odd sketch of John playing Basil talking on the phone at the FT reception in which he insists to the unknown person on the other end that the series is finished. Bizarre.

chapters.title: The Grange
chapters.description: Pictures of the "real" Fawlty Towers hotel.  After being burnt down, the Grange housing estate was built in its place.

chapters.title: Birth of Fawlty Towers
chapters.description: John Cleese tell the story behind the creation of the series.

chapters.title: John Cleese and Andrew Sachs in We Are Most Amused
Fawlty Towers Polly What have you done to my hotel
chapters.description: A very short film showing pictures of the demolished "Grange", the hotel featured in the opening title sequence and for exteriors of "Fawlty Towers"

chapters.title: The Fawlty Towers Building in Ashes

chapters.title: A Touch of Class
chapters.description: An confidence trickster comes to stay at the hotel, just after Basil has taken an ad in a posh magazine to upgrade the clientele.

chapters.title: The Builders
chapters.description: The Fawltys take a holiday and leave Polly and Manuel to run the place just as O'Reilly's builders come to redo the lobby.

chapters.title: The Wedding Party
chapters.description: Basil wants 'none of that' going on in his rooms and suspects some guests and Polly of carrying on.

chapters.title: The Hotel Inspectors
chapters.description: Some inspectors are in town and Basil gets paranoid, so he alternately fawns over and offends his guests.

chapters.title: Gourmet Night
chapters.description: To bring the right type of crowd into the hotel Basil establishes a Gourmet Night.

chapters.title: The Germans
chapters.description: Sybil goes into the hospital for toe surgery, leaving Basil to cope with a fire drill single-handed. After a couple of blows on the head, Basil tells some German guests where Germany went wrong in WWII.

chapters.title: Communication Problems
chapters.description: A selectively deaf woman named Mrs Richards insists that she has had a large amount of money stolen at the hotel, and against Sybil's wishes Basil puts a fiver on Dragonfly.

chapters.title: The Psychiatrist
chapters.description: A psychiatrist and his wife come to stay and Basil thinks Sybil is telling them all about his life.

chapters.title: Waldorf Salad
chapters.description: An American and his wife get unsatisfactory service at Fawlty Towers when he orders a Waldorf salad, after the kitchen has closed.

chapters.title: The Kipper and the Corpse
chapters.description: Unknown to Basil, a guest dies in the night and he tries to serve him breakfast anyway and an obnoxious woman insists on service for her dog.

chapters.title: The Anniversary
chapters.description: Sybil leaves before Basil's surprise anniversary party and Basil spends the evening trying to convince their friends she's ill.

chapters.title: Basil the Rat
chapters.description: The health inspector is coming and Basil tells Manuel to get rid of his pet rat, which he later finds out is named Basil.

title: Steins;Gate
description: A group of friends have customized their microwave so that it can send text messages to the past. As they perform different experiments, an organization named SERN who has been doing their own research on time travel tracks them down and now the characters have to find a way to avoid being captured by them.

seasons.title: Specials
seasons.description: It is a long established fact that a reader will be distracted by the readable content of a page when looking at its layout. The point of using Lorem Ipsum is that it has a more-or-less normal distribution

chapters.title: Egoistic Poriomania
chapters.description: A few months after the events of Steins;Gate, Rintarou Okabe and his group of friends are invited to tag along with their acquaintance Faris NyanNyan, who is participating in a Rai-Net battle event in the United States. There, they meet up with an old colleague: Kurisu Makise, who has been recalling fragmented memories of events that happened in the other world lines in the form of dreams. She confronts Okabe, questioning him as to whether these events—particularly the incidents between the two of them—did indeed happen.

chapters.title: Steins;Gate the Movie: Loading Area of Déjà vu
chapters.description: The film takes place one year after the events of the anime series. After going through a painstaking journey across multiple 'World Lines' due to the invention of 'D-Mail', text messages that can be sent to the past, Rintarō Okabe has assumedly landed in the "Steins Gate" World Line, in which none of his friends would have to die and a future ruled by SERN due to the invention of a time machine no longer exists. However, Rintarō soon starts feeling the side effects of his constant time travelling across multiple World Lines, which soon builds up and causes Rintarō to suddenly vanish from existence, with only Kurisu Makise, the girl who he had saved thanks to his efforts, remembering him through déjà vu. It is now up to Kurisu to find a way to get Rintarō back.

chapters.title: The Sagacious Wisdom of Cognitive Computing: Cooking Chapter
chapters.description: Mayuri and Kurisu attempt to make some fried chicken with help of a cognitive computing-based Upa terminal, only to find they lack the actual ingredients they need. Thus, with Upa's help, they find something they can make with what they have in the lab.

chapters.title: The Sagacious Wisdom of Cognitive Computing: Navigation Chapter
chapters.description: After Rintaro and Kurisu get into an argument with each other, they both use Upa to try and navigate their way home without bumping into each other. Instead, Upa arranges them to take the long route so they can make up with each other.

chapters.title: The Sagacious Wisdom of Cognitive Computing: Fashion Chapter
chapters.description: When it becomes apparent that Rintaro and Daru pretty much wear the same clothes all the time, Kurisu uses Upa to try and come up with some different outfits for them based on their hobbies and personalities.

chapters.title: The Sagacious Wisdom of Cognitive Computing: Meeting Chapter
chapters.description: Following complaints from Yugo, Upa heads up a meeting concerning a potential new location for the lab, much to Rintaro's dismay.

chapters.title: Open the Missing Link -Divide by Zero-
chapters.description: An alternative episode 23 where the story diverges from the original series. The events of this episode lead into the Steins;Gate 0 series.

chapters.title: Turning Point
chapters.description: A self-described mad scientist attends a lecture on time travel, stumbles upon the dead body of a familiarly unfamiliar woman, and discovers that his text messages are no longer bound by the rules of space and time.

chapters.title: Paranoia of Time Leaps
chapters.description: Rintarō is surprised that Kurisu is alive, before being humiliated by her during a lecture concerning time travel. After getting some provisions from crossdresser Ruka Urushibara and meeting Suzuha Amane, who gets hired to work part time in the electronic's shop below his apartment, Rintarō investigates the supposedly altered events and learns of a man calling himself John Titor who claims to be a time traveller. Rintarō then discovers the books he had on John Titor had disappeared as if they never existed. The next day, Rintarō encounters a strange woman named Moeka Kiryū who asks for information on a retro PC, which Rintarō gathers from Hashida. Later, whilst testing a banana on their microwave which then disappears, Rintarō and Hashida find the banana reattached to the bunch it came from in its gelled state, before Kurisu appears before them once again.

chapters.title: Paranoia of Parallel Process
chapters.description: Rintarō agrees to let Kurisu look at the mobile microwave on the condition she become a lab member. They discover that Hashida was using the microwave at the time Rintarō sent his text about Kurisu's stabbing. Despite the microwave causing a large electrical discharge when Mayuri opens it in the middle of operating, Rintarō concludes that the mobile microwave is, in fact, a time machine. After hearing about the large hadron collider and micro-black-holes, Rintarō asks Hashida to hack into CERN's network. There, they discover they had already been performing micro-black-hole experiments, kept hidden from the public, which reveals that humans had died during them.

chapters.title: Rendezvous of Abstract Fluctuation
chapters.description: With further information encrypted in a code that Hashida can't decifer, Rintarō learns from John Titor that he needs the IBN 5100 computer Moeka was looking for to decode it. Whilst doing his laundry, Rintarō runs into Kurisu, who is still in denial about a time machine existing. After Mayuri hears from her co-worker, Feiris Nyannyan, that she knows about the IBN-5100, Rintarō plays a game before learning that the computer is at the shrine where Ruka works. After getting permission to borrow it from Ruka's father, Rintarō and Kurisu carry it back to the lab.

chapters.title: Rendezvous of Electrical Charge Conflict
chapters.description: As Rintarō and Kurisu arrive home with the IBN 5100, Suzuha seems to be shocked when she sees Kurisu. As Rintarō gathers some needed parts, he runs into Suzuha again, who warns her to be cautious of Kurisu and acts strangely when a helicopter passes by. After Hashida gets the IBN 5100 working, he, Rintarō and Kurisu begin deciphering SERN's reports. They discover that they had indeed been experimenting with time travel, with their attempts of sending humans back in time resulting in the same jellification Rintarō had performed on the bananas. With this knowledge, Rintarō becomes determined to perfect his Mobile Microwave.

chapters.title: Butterfly Effect's Divergence
chapters.description: The lab members discuss how to perfect the Mobile Microwave, dubbing messages sent to the past as 'D-Mails'. Further experimenting reveals the various rules concerning D-Mails; being that it can only be sent during a certain time of the day, long messages are split into several smaller mails, and the timer on the microwave determines how far back the message is sent. The next day, Moeka comes round to see the IBN 5100 and, after hearing about the time experiments, is made a lab member.

chapters.title: Divergence Singularity
chapters.description: After some improvements are made to the Mobile Microwave, Rintarō decides to experiment changing the past by sending winning lottery numbers to the past. After sending the text, the past is changed to where Ruka has bought a lottery ticket, but Rintarō didn't perform the experiment, with only Rintarō retaining the memory of what had happened, realising time has been put onto a new timeline. Confused as to why only he can remember the previous timeline, Rintarō contacts John Titor, who tells him he may have the power to become a messiah and change the future.

chapters.title: Homeostasis of Dreams
chapters.description: As Rintarō decides to resume his experiments, Moeka requests to send a D-Mail. As she sends the D-Mail, Rintarō is shifted onto a new timeline where Moeka never came to the lab. The next day, Ruka comes to the lab, asking to send a D-Mail to the past so that he would be born as a girl. They send a D-Mail to Ruka's mother's pager from before he was born, letting her know of an urban legend about how mothers-to-be can affect their baby's gender by eating certain foods. Rintarō moves to a new world line, though he doesn't notice anything particularly different at first.

chapters.title: Homeostasis of Illusions
chapters.description: Maid café waitress Rumiho Akiha, a.k.a. Feyris Nyan Nyan, learns about the Mobile Microwave as Rintarō discusses it with Hashida, becoming very interested in it. Later, Rintarō discovers that the IBN-5100 has gone missing, as if they never found it in the first place, most likely as a result of Moeka's D-Mail. After learning that the IBN-5100 had been previously taken from Ruka's shrine, Rintarō finds Moeka in town, but she doesn't know where the IBN-5100 is either. Rintarō also finds out that Ruka's D-Mail has caused Mayuri to know Moeka in this timeline. Rintarō, Hashida and Mayuri go to see Rumiho, whose family owns Akihabara and originally donated the IBN-5100 to the shrine. She offers them a replacement in exchange for being allowed to send a D-Mail ten years into the past. As history is changed again, the IBN-5100 was never donated to the shrine and, more disturbingly, the face of Akihabara has completely changed, no longer being a mecca for anime.

chapters.title: Homeostasis of Complements
chapters.description: Rintarō realises the D-Mail Rumiho sent prevented moe culture from being introduced into Akihabara. As Rintarō wonders why the relationships between his friends hasn't been affected, he comes to realise that Ruka's gender had in fact been changed. Afterwards, Rintarō talks with Suzuha, who revealed she came to Tokyo to try and find her estranged father, mentioning she will leave if she is unable to find him the next day. As Rintarō contemplates holding a party for her, offering the chance to send a D-Mail if she fails, he receives a text message letting him know that someone is watching him. Mayuri mentions how Rintarō fell sick when he was younger, which he believes to be the origins of his 'Reading Steiner', his ability to travel between world lines with his memories intact. That night, after some mishaps in preparing the party, Suzuha doesn't show and simply sends a farewell text to Rintarō. He decides to send a D-Mail to himself telling him to follow her, changing history so she ended up attending the party and staying in Tokyo. In this new timeline, the satellite that had crashed into a building in Akihabara has mysteriously disappeared.

chapters.title: Dogma of Space-Time Boundary
chapters.description: Rintarō discovers that a television in the electronics shop below the lab is the key to the time slot in which D-Mails can be sent. Kurisu then theorises that it might be possible to send memories back in time in the same manner as D-Mails, effectively allowing people to 'leap' to the past. As Rintarō goes into town with Mayuri to look for parts Kurisu needs, running into Moeka along the way, Suzuha tells Rintarō that Kurisu works for SERN, though Kurisu denies this when asked. Kurisu tells Rintarō about the troubles she has with her father, who grew to hate her when she surpassed him in scientific prowess, though cheers up when Rintarō offers to help them reunite. As Mayuri and Kurisu decide to have a sleepover at the lab, Rintarō receives another sinister text message warning him that he knows too much, later learning that the lab is connected to the SERN network without the lab members' knowing.

chapters.title: Dogma in Ergosphere
chapters.description: With the ability to utilise the LHC, Kurisu completes her 'time leap machine'. However, Rintarō, still tortured by the texts he has received, decides against performing an experiment, instead suggesting they announce it to the public. As the lab members decide to have a party, Kurisu comes into conflict with Suzuha, who claims she is destined to become a SERN spy, but Mayuri manages to calm things down. As a bomb threat is televised, Suzuha, after hearing about the lab's connection to SERN, suspects something is terribly wrong and leaves. Just then, the lab is attacked by a group of armed men, led by Moeka who reveals herself to be from SERN. Demanding Rintarō, Kurisu and Hashida hand over the time machine and come with her, she decides Mayuri isn't needed and kills her.

chapters.title: Necrosis of Metaphysical
chapters.description: Right after Moeka kills Mayuri, Suzuha rushes in the lab and creates a distraction, allowing Kurisu to use the time leap machine to send Rintarō back in time to 5 p.m. of the same day. Rintarō drives everyone away from the lab, but wastes most of his time searching for Mayuri. By the time they try to escape the area, the bomb threat has stopped the subway and Mayuri is killed when Moeka runs her over with a car. Rintarō manages to escape the clutches of SERN and leaps to the past again. Using his knowledge of Mayuri's movements from his previous leap, he manages to find her sooner and they visit a different subway station. However, Mayuri dies again when Mr Braun's daughter, Nae, accidentally pushes her in the way of an oncoming train. Devastated, Rintarō vows to keep leaping to the past until he manages to save Mayuri.

chapters.title: Necrosis of Physical
chapters.description: Rintarō makes several time leaps, but no matter what, Mayuri always ends up dying in some way. In one of those leaps, Rintarō calls out Moeka and holds her at gunpoint, making her reveal that SERN have targeted the lab due to the creation of the time machine and their plan to publicly announce it. As Rintarō falls further into despair, Kurisu gets him to reveal what he knows and offers to help him try to save Mayuri. She sends Rintarō to just before she completed the time leap machine, where he tells her past self what he knows. As they discuss what the cause of Mayuri's death could be, they are greeted by Suzuha, who tells them that in order to save Mayuri, they need to find a specific World Line. She takes them to the crashed satellite, which turns out to be her time machine, and reveals she is "John Titor" and has come from the year 2036.

chapters.title: Missing Link Necrosis
chapters.description: Suzuha explains how SERN was able to build a time machine and use it to rule the world in 2036. She explains she plans to travel to 1975 to acquire an IBN-5100, but soon discovers her time machine has broken down as a result of the storm on the night Rintarō stopped her from leaving. Rintarō leaps two days before the completion of the time leap machine in order to get Hashida to help fix Suzuha's time machine, whilst Mayuri suggests they also help find Suzuha's father, using his badge as a clue. Suzuha gives Rintarō her Divergence Meter, which keeps track of the magnitude of differences between timelines, and tells him about how he founded the resistance against SERN in the future. After spending the day searching for Suzuha's father, Suzuha gives her thanks to Rintarō before he receives a lead on Suzuha's father from a badge maker.

chapters.title: Sacrificial Necrosis
chapters.description: Unable to get much information about the badge maker's client, Rintarō decides to leap back in time to confront the client in question, only to find it was Hashida, who wanted to make a fake badge to cheer Suzuha up. Hashida then mentions that Suzuha's time machine is only able to travel backwards in time. As the repairs to the time machine are completed, Mayuri deduces from the time machine's naming convention that Suzuha's father is actually Hashida. After a short reunion, Suzuha travels back to 1975, though Rintarō notices the Divergence Meter's reading hasn't changed. Later, Mr. Braun delivers a letter from Suzuha from the year 2000, mentioning that she commited suicide a year later. In the letter, Suzuha laments that she failed her mission, as the damaged time machine caused her to lose her memories for 24 years. Rintarō blames himself for stopping her on the night of the party and, despite Mayuri's pleas, sends a D-Mail that stops him from following Suzuha, letting her use the time machine before it was damaged. Speaking with Mr. Braun again, Rintarō learns that Suzuha has died of illness instead, leaving behind her Divergence Meter. Noticing a small change in divergence, Rintarō returns home and finds Mayuri has not been killed by Moeka.

chapters.title: Made in Complex
chapters.description: Despite the change in divergence, Mayuri's death still takes place, albeit a day later than in previous timelines. Rintarō asks for Kurisu's help, who theorises that, since negating Rintarō's D-Mail about Suzuha delayed the attack, undoing the effects of the other D-Mails could bring them back to a World Line where they have an IBN-5100, letting them hack into SERN and delete the records that set them on Rintarō's trail. Rintarō starts by trying to figure out how to reverse Rumiho's D-Mail, while helping her evade a rival gaming gang. Rintarō takes Rumiho to the place where her maid cafe used to be and tells her about the way Akihabara was. Rumiho comes to remember the previous timeline and the D-Mail she sent: a fake ransom note, which prevented her father from boarding a plane fated to crash. The rival gang catches up to them but they are rescued by the arrival of Rumiho's father. Speaking to him, Rintarō learns that Suzuha gave him the IBN-5100, but he was forced to sell it in order to pay for the fake kidnapping's ransom. After accepting the reality of her father's death, Rumiho agrees to send a D-Mail cancelling out her previous one, turning Akihabara back into a moe hub. The IBN-5100, however, still remains out of reach.

chapters.title: Androgynous Fractale
chapters.description: Rintarō tells Ruka about how she used to be a man and urges her to reverse the D-Mail responsible in order to change Mayuri's fate. While she initially disbelieves him, ultimately she agrees, on the condition that Rintarō takes her on a date. Despite Kurisu and Hashida's advice on dating, Rukako and Rintarō spend the evening in awkward conversation. Like Rumiho, Ruka eventually recalls the previous timeline, which makes her even more depressed at the impending return to it, since she feels she will be unable to pursue her feelings about Rintarō as a guy. Before sending the D-Mail that will cancel out Ruka's first one, Rintarō realises that the reason she didn't enjoy their date was that he was trying to be someone he's not. He visits the shrine and tells her that, no matter what, she'll always be his "student". With their relationship repaired, the world line shifts, turning Ruka back into a guy and leaving only one more D-Mail to be reversed: Moeka's.

chapters.title: Infinite Chain of Apoptosis
chapters.description: As Kurisu offers to look after Mayuri at a doujin convention, Rintarō heads to Moeka's address, only to learn that she had killed herself. After finding out the deadline of Mayuri's death in this world line, Rintarō time leaps to before Moeka killed herself, finding her in a nervous wreck having not been contacted by someone known as 'FB'. Rintarō steals Moeka's phone and sends a D-Mail from it, but the timeline doesn't shift, leading him to realise that another message was sent from her phone. Rintarō confronts Moeka about FB and tells her about her future suicide. Rintarō finds the offending mail, which involved the location of the IBN-5100, but sending a D-Mail from that phone doesn't affect the world line. As Rintarō decides he needs to send a D-Mail from FB's phone, Moeka tells him the location of the IBN-5100.

chapters.title: Finalize Apoptosis
chapters.description: Despite Rintarō knowing the location of the IBN-5100, Kurisu is against him trying to steal it, as it most likely won't affect the world line. Instead, she suggests to Rintarō that he stake out the location in order to find FB, with Moeka deciding to join him. As they observe the IBN-5100 being taking out, they follow it as it is passed along to several people, including Mr. Braun, before it ends up on a plane towards France. Rintarō, Moeka and Kurisu go to confront Mr. Braun, who reveals himself to be FB, killing Moeka before taking his own life. Rintarō uses Braun's cell phone to cancel out Moeka's D-Mail, returning to a World Line where both Moeka and Braun are alive and he possesses the IBN-5100. As Rintarō gets Hashida to hack into the SERN network to erase the data they have on them, he comes to sudden realisation that he needs to undo an additional D-Mail: the one that prevented Kurisu from getting stabbed.

chapters.title: Paradox Meltdown
chapters.description: Not wanting to move to a World Line where Kurisu dies, Rintarō decides against the hacking. As he accompanies Mayuri to a Comic Market, he tries to think of a way he can save her without changing World Lines, too afraid to tell Kurisu the reason behind his change of plans. As a car appears during Mayuri's fated time to die, Rintarō attempts to change her destiny by letting the car hit him instead, but Mayuri ends up dying trying to save him. After he leaps back in time, Kurisu has Rintarō reveal to her that she dies in the Beta World Line. As Rintarō finds Mayuri visiting her grandmother's grave, he overhears that she's been having dreams of the times she has died, and about how she has noticed Rintarō's suffering.

chapters.title: Being Meltdown
chapters.description: As Rintarō and Kurisu hide out from the rain, she explains how she recalls her stabbing from dreams, as well as Rintarō's various attempts at saving Mayuri. When Kurisu tells Rintarō that he should save Mayuri over her, he can't accept it and runs off. As Rintarō attempts to time leap again, Kurisu stops him, worried that seeing Mayuri die over and over will destroy him. After giving in and choosing to go save Mayuri, Rintarō tells Kurisu he loves her, to which she responds by kissing him. The next day, Kurisu leaves for Japan, whilst Rintarō and the others delete their data from the SERN network. Just then, Kurisu returns to tell Rintarō she loves him, just before the data deletion takes him to the Beta World Line. After getting rid of the Mobile Microwave, Rintarō receives a call from Suzuha, telling him about World War III.

chapters.title: Open the Steins Gate
chapters.description: Suzuha explains that her mission is to prevent Kurisu's death and enter a World Line known as 'Stein's Gate' so that World War III will never happen. With a small chance of saving Kurisu, Rintaro agrees to go with Suzuha to just before Kurisu's death. As Rintaro waits in the place where Kurisu's stabbing takes place, he sees Kurisu's father, the Professor Nakamachi he saw that day, attack Kurisu as he tries to steal her time travel theory. As Rintaro attempts to save Kurisu, he inadvertently stabs her himself, allowing Nakamachi to escape with her theory and bring it to Russia. Returning to the present, Rintaro falls into despair but Mayuri knocks some sense into him. Afterwards, Rintaro receives a video mail from his future self, telling him that the key to saving Kurisu without changing the events that led him to create a time machine is to fool his other self into believing Kurisu had died.

chapters.title: Achievement Point
chapters.description: Picking up a sabre toy in order to use its liquid as a substitute for Kurisu's blood, Rintaro and Suzuha return to the day of Kurisu's death. First, he makes sure to obtain a metal toy Mayuri previously found in order to prevent Nakabachi to successfully bring Kurisu's theory to Russia. As he prepares to fake Kurisu's death, Rintaro finds the liquid in the sabre had dried up. To this end, he allows himself to be stabbed by Nakabachi, before knocking out Kurisu with a taser and using his own blood to set the scene up for his past self. As Rintaro returns to the past, Suzuha gives her thanks before time is altered so that the time machine was never invented. In this new timeline, Rintaro goes around giving badges to his past lab members, eventually managing to meet Kurisu once again; she was looking for Rintaro to thank him for saving her life, suggesting that the event of their romance doesn't disappear, either.

seasons.title: Steins;Gate 0
seasons.description: It is a long established fact that a reader will be distracted by the readable content of a page when looking at its layout. The point of using Lorem Ipsum is that it has a more-or-less normal distribution

chapters.title: Missing Link of the Annihilator -Absolute Zero-
chapters.description: Though WWIII is on the horizon, Okabe attempts to live a normal college life. However, a newly developed AI is about to shake up his world.

chapters.title: Epigraph of the Closed Curve -Closed Epigraph-
chapters.description: After a chance encounter with Maho where they discover knowing someone in common, Okabe has his first face-to-face with her special AI, Amadeus.

chapters.title: Protocol of the Two-sided Gospel -X-day Protocol-
chapters.description: Mayuri tries to bring everyone together for a Christmas party at the lab, but Okabe has a rude awakening.

chapters.title: Solitude of the Mournful Flow -A Stray Sheep-
chapters.description: While Okabe Rintarou briefly has a vision of a world line where he is caught up in the middle of a war, which he eventually comes to realize was his Reading Steiner taking effect. Meanwhile, Suzuha explains to Daru that she is looking for Kagari Shiina, Mayuri's future adopted daughter who time-traveled with her from the year 2036 but became separated from her in 1998. As Rintarou decides to help with the search, he gets a call from Ruka Urashibara about a pressing matter before finding Moeka before his doorstep. be is left with more questions than answers, Suzuha recruits help in her search for an unexpectedly close person.

chapters.title: Solitude of the Astigmatism -Entangled Sheep-
chapters.description: Their search continues as New Years swiftly approaches, though Ruka's dilemma with a certain guest might make matters worse.

chapters.title: Eclipse of Orbital Ordering -The Orbital Eclipse-
chapters.description: Now that the girl's identity is known, Okabe and friends kick off the New Years with a shrine visit and party to never forget.

chapters.title: Eclipse of Vibronic Transition -Vibronic Transition-
chapters.description: The armed men attempt to abduct Kagari but are forced to flee empty-handed when Yugo Tennouji arrives and disarms them. Concluding that group are not the same Rounders he had previously encountered, Rintaro approaches Tennouji, using his knowledge over him being a member of a Rounders to acquire his help in protecting Kagari. Meanwhile, as Maho continues to find herself locked out of Amadeus, Ruka tries to question of Suzuha over what everyone is keeping from him. Later, Rintaro suddenly receives a distress call from Amadeus, at which point his Reading Steiner activates and he is sent to another world line where Kurisu is still alive.

chapters.title: Dual of Antinomy -Antinomic Dual-
chapters.description: Rintaro soon comes to realise that he has once again ended up in the alpha world line where Mayuri is dead, as the Rintaro of this world line couldn't go through with sacrificing Kurisu in order to save her. Realising that this Rintaro came from another world line, Kurisu reveals she has rebuilt the Phone Microwave, asking him to use it to return to his world line. As Rintaro struggles with his decision, Kurisu takes him to Mayuri's grave, urging him to wake up from his dream. After advising Rintaro not to interact so much with Amadeus, Kurisu kisses Rintaro before sending a D-Mail, returning him to the beta world line.

chapters.title: Pandora of Eternal Return -Pandora's Box-
chapters.description: It will take time for Okabe to identify the attackers and their motivation, but the impending crisis of WWIII forces Suzuha to resort to desperate measures.

chapters.title: Pandora of Provable Existence -Forbidden Cubicle-
chapters.description: After reinforcements are called to clean Maho's disastrous room, her and Okabe's Akihabara date ends with a surprising confession from Maho.

chapters.title: Pandora of Forgotten Existence -Sealed Reliquary-
chapters.description: Okabe must convince Maho to give up her prized possession, but an unexpected danger has them negotiating for their own lives.

chapters.title: Mother Goose of Mutual Recursion -Recursive Mother Goose-
chapters.description: Kagari attempts to track down the origins of a song in hopes that she discovers her lost memories.

chapters.title: Mother Goose of Diffractive Recitativo -Diffraction Mother Goose-
chapters.description: After finally obtaining a hint into Kagari's lost past, Okabe ends up discovering much more than he bargained for.

chapters.title: Recognition of the Elastic Limit -Presage or Recognize-
chapters.description: Shocked by a surprise attack, Suzuha and Daru look to America as their last hope to save the world.

chapters.title: Recognition of the Asymptotic Line -Recognize Asymptote-
chapters.description: Fed up with her Dad's passiveness, Suzuha must make a man out of Daru before Yuki ends up with somebody else.

chapters.title: Altair of the Point at Infinity -Vega and Altair-
chapters.description: Okabe's stubbornness causes fists to fly and tears to be shed as the deadline for using the time machine swiftly approaches.

chapters.title: Altair of the Hyperbolic Plane -Beltrami Pseudosphere-
chapters.description: As Suzuha sets off to finish her mission, Mayuri finds determination of her own. But then, disaster strikes.

chapters.title: Altair of Translational Symmetry -Translational Symmetry-
chapters.description: All hell breaks loose over the time machine when a villain from the future haunts the past and unveils their devious plan.

chapters.title: Altair of the Cyclic Coordinate -Time-leap Machine-
Rinascimento of the Unwavering Promise -Promised Rinascimento-
Rinascimento of Image Formation -Return of Phoenix-
Arclight of the Point at Infinity -Arclight of the Sky-

title: Six Feet Under
description:
A darkly comic look at members of a dysfunctional L.A. family that run a funeral business. 

When death is your business, what is your life? For the Fisher family, the world outside of their family-owned funeral home continues to be at least as challenging as--and far less predictable than--the one inside.

seasons.description: It is a long established fact that a reader will be distracted by the readable content of a page when looking at its layout. The point of using Lorem Ipsum is that it has a more-or-less normal distribution
